programme.title: Dialog
programme.desc: Cykl prezentujący wyselekcjonowany zbiór najlepszych filmów krótkometrażowych. Wiele z nich nagrodzonych zostało prestiżowymi wyróżnieniami na międzynarodowych galach i festiwalach filmowych. Każde pasmo przedstawia kilka produkcji na dany temat.

programme.title: Hi, How Are You
programme.desc: Bezrobotny pięćdziesięcioletni Sławek (Jacek Poniedziałek) ma problem z zabiciem wolnego czasu. Mężczyzna przesiaduje w domu bądź włóczy się po osiedlu, szukając zaginionego kota. W najlepszym razie wykonuje różnego rodzaju prace zlecone mu przez żonę. Pewnego dnia Sławek poznaje tajemniczą sąsiadkę Kamilę (Maja Szopa). Kobieta zaprasza go do swojego ogrodu.

credits.actor: Jacek Poniedziałek
Maja Szopa
Aleksandra Justa
Arkadiusz Brykalski
Monika Kwiatkowska
Witold Dębicki
Jacek Domański

programme.title: Sufit
Katto
programme.desc: Olavi (Juho Milonoff) się rozwodzi. Szukając zapomnienia od związanych z tym nieprzyjemnych okoliczności, przyjeżdża do letniego domku. Na miejscu się przekonuje, że sufit w tajemniczy sposób się obniżył.

credits.actor: Inna Bodson
Juho Milonoff
Pekka Strang

programme.title: Keeping Faith
Keeping Faith
Zaczęło się w środę
Keeping Faith
programme.desc:
Keeping Faith: Created by Matthew Hall. With Eve Myles, Bradley Freegard, Mark Lewis Jones, Hannah Daniel. Faith, a small-town Welsh lawyer, is forced to cut short her extended maternity leave when her husband and business partner, Evan, goes missing. As the truth of his actions surface, Faith must fight to protect her family and her sanity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6658720/","name":"Keeping Faith","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQzMDMyMzItMTg2MS00NmFiLThhZGMtNzhiZGIzNjE3NWE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQ5NTYyOTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Faith, a small-town Welsh lawyer, is forced to cut short her extended maternity leave when her husband and business partner, Evan, goes missing. programme.title: Charter
Nie tak miało być
Charter
programme.desc: Charter: Directed by Amanda Kernell. With Ane Dahl Torp, Sverrir Gudnason, Troy Lundkvist, Tintin Poggats Sarri. After a divorce, Alice hasn't seen her children in two months as she awaits a custody verdict. When her son calls her in the middle of the night, Alice takes action, abducting the children on an illicit charter trip to the Canary Islands." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9850050/","name":"Charter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDlmYzJhZjQtYWQxZi00NWY4LTlmZmEtYTM5MWQzZTVmZmE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyNzI4ODY3._V1_.jpg","description":"After a divorce, Alice hasn't seen her children in two months as she awaits a custody verdict. When her son calls her in the middle of the night, Alice takes action, abducting the children on an illicit charter trip to the Canary Isl","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9850050/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sir_AmirSyarif"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amanda Kernell delivers a highly realistic depiction of divorce fight in all its ugly glory","reviewBody":"'Charter' has a clear Scandinavian calm and methodical narrative tone with sparse dialogue. Written and directed by Amanda Kernell, the movie asks important questions about parenting and responsibility - two concepts that turn out do not always fit in the same vein. You won't find straightforward answers here, which is exactly what makes this Swedish drama so worthwhile. The acting performances are realistic and so very good, especially from Ane Dahl Torps.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1070,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-03-13","keywords":"metaphoric title,husband wife relationship,mother son relationship,mother daughter relationship,father son relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2589244953","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDUzNGEwNTEtZTIwMC00OTU1LThiZjQtMTkzZjg1MzZjMzI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDUzNGEwNTEtZTIwMC00OTU1LThiZjQtMTkzZjg1MzZjMzI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1335996/","name":"Ane Dahl Torp"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0345695/","name":"Sverrir Gudnason"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10509072/","name":"Troy Lundkvist"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1840544/","name":"Amanda Kernell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048411/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056024/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031669/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1840544/","name":"Amanda Kernell"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Babyteeth
Zaraza
Ill: Final Contagium
programme.desc:
Babyteeth: Directed by Shannon Murphy. With Eliza Scanlen, Michelle Lotters, Toby Wallace, Sora Wakaki. Milla, a seriously ill teenager, falls in love with a drug dealer, Moses, her parents' worst nightmare." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8399664/","name":"Babyteeth","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGRhMzRkYzEtMDBjNy00YjkxLWJjNzctNzEwNGNhZDUyZWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTE1MzI2NzIz._V1_.jpg","description":"Milla, a seriously ill teenager, falls in love with a drug dealer, Moses, her parents' worst nightmare.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8399664/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"evanston_dad"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Well Acted But Very Depressing","reviewBody":"Well acted but very depressing.

Eliza Scanlan gives a fascinating performance as a young woman who's going through cancer treatment and falls for a drug addict who may or may not be good for her. Her parents (Essie Davis and Ben Mendelsohn) are dysfunctional and unraveling and have drug problems of their own. They don't like her daughter's boyfriend and under normal circumstances probably wouldn't tolerate him. But he's the only thing that brings their daughter some respite from the hell she's going through, so they sort of adopt him as their own.

"Babyteeth" is a coming of age movie that's set apart from others like it because of the protagonist's existential crisis. Scanlan's character is as immature in some ways as any sixteen year old, but at the same time is being asked to summon up reserves of maturity to deal with the ultimate curve ball life has to throw at us. How do you balance the emotional and hormonal ups and downs of teen romance with the possibility of your impending death?

The film is a bit monotonous in tone and starts to feel like a grind after a while. But again, it's worth seeing for the performances and for the unsentimental treatment of the subject matter that would have possibly segued into the maudlin in different hands. The ending scene is the most devastating thing I've seen in a movie this year.

Grade: B+","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14022,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"MA-17","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2020-07-23","keywords":"pills,dog,teenage girl loses her hair,teenage girl wears a wig,hospital","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Babyteeth","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi678936601","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzM2ODA5ZDItMjJjMS00ZTYxLTk3ODItOTNiMGEwZGQ2NzNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzM2ODA5ZDItMjJjMS00ZTYxLTk3ODItOTNiMGEwZGQ2NzNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7340546/","name":"Eliza Scanlen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9334013/","name":"Michelle Lotters"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3108675/","name":"Toby Wallace"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2221724/","name":"Shannon Murphy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0234956/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0658237/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017733/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1514808/","name":"Rita Kalnejais"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Planta permanente
Kafeteria
Planta permanente
programme.desc:
Planta permanente: Directed by Ezequiel Radusky. With Liliana Juárez, Rosario Bléfari, Verónica Perrotta, Nina Vera Suárez Bléfari. Lila and Marcela have always worked on the cleaning staff of a state office. They know its nooks and crannies better than anyone, and have found a way to support themselves - and a dream - running a clandestine kitchen in an abandoned corner of the building. But times change: a new director arrives, spouting cynical speeches full of clichés with a fistful of empty promises. The kitchen is closed and a wave of redundancies disrupts the precarious equilibrium in the office, making everyday tasks a struggle for survival." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11306358/","name":"Planta permanente","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjE2ZDkyZjItYWIwMC00YmE0LTlmZTgtYWNiMWQ5ZGZhNTE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDUwMDg1ODU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lila and Marcela have always worked on the cleaning staff of a state office. They know its nooks and crannies better than anyone, and have found a way to support themselves - and a dream - running a clandestine kitchen in an abandone","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11306358/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"danybur"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A film that presents us with the centrality of work and its impact on ties","reviewBody":"Lila and Marcela (Liliana Juárez and Rosario Bléfari, in her last film role) are old friends and have been working for years as cleaning personnel in a provincial Public Works Department. Also a long time ago and as I searched, both run a dining room in an unoccupied sector of the building to which most of the employees willingly attend. The arrival of a new Director (Verónica Perrota), who recalls the speech and the ways of a recent and prominent governor, calls into question the job security of the staff and the continuity of the dining room.

What is disturbing about this film by Ezequiel Radusky is the chronicle of how the variation of the status quo takes the unexpected path of undermining the relationship of both friends and partners. On the other hand, the movements of Lila (a true entrepreneur) to preserve or reconvert her irregular "undertaking" against all odds are moving. Impossible not to love her after the remarkable performance of Liliana Juárez, winner of the award for best actress for this role at the last Mar del Plata Film Festival.

The harshness of some situations are resolved with the best resource: humor, in an arduous film in several senses.

In short, a film that presents us with the centrality of work (in situations that are not exclusive to public employment) and its impact on ties and to what extent individual resistance to power and adverse changes is a possible path or a trap.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":160,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-11-15","keywords":"work,cleaning lady,cleaning,new director,friendship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Tráiler [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2604449817","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWFhMjY5MTYtNDUwMC00Y2U1LWEzYmMtZjA4ZTc0MDIyNWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWFhMjY5MTYtNDUwMC00Y2U1LWEzYmMtZjA4ZTc0MDIyNWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4989891/","name":"Liliana Juárez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0088164/","name":"Rosario Bléfari"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1213740/","name":"Verónica Perrotta"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4991308/","name":"Ezequiel Radusky"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0250991/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0202630/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1195308/","name":"Diego Lerman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4991308/","name":"Ezequiel Radusky"}],"duration":"PT1H18M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Source Code: Directed by Duncan Jones. With Jake Gyllenhaal, Michelle Monaghan, Vera Farmiga, Jeffrey Wright. A soldier wakes up in someone else's body and discovers he's part of an experimental government program to find the bomber of a commuter train within 8 minutes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0945513/","name":"Source Code","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0MTc3MzMzNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDE4MjE0NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A soldier wakes up in someone else's body and discovers he's part of an experimental government program to find the bomber of a commuter train within 8 minutes.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0945513/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rick-98899"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nailbiting....","reviewBody":"I love this movie and have rewatched it a few times over the years. Duncan Jones has impressed with other offerings such as Moon and Warcraft and I look forward to his future ventures. Jake Gyllenhaal (another favourite) plays the protaganist brilliantly and the angst, apprehension and despair that he portrays while trying to figure out Source Code is palpable. programme.title: The Lost Son
Zaginiony syn
The Lost Son
programme.desc:
The Lost Son: Directed by Chris Menges. With Daniel Auteuil, Nastassja Kinski, Katrin Cartlidge, Marianne Denicourt. Xavier Lombard is a world-weary private eye in London, in exile from his native Paris; his best friend is Nathalie, a high-class call girl. He gets a call from an old friend from the Paris police department, now a businessman whose brother-in-law is missing. The missing man's parents hire Xavier over their daughter's objections, and quickly he finds himself in the realm of children's sexual slavery. He guesses that the lost son is dead and shifts his focus to finding and breaking this lucrative business of child trafficking. He involves a reluctant Nathalie to hunt "the Austrian," the shadowy head of the business. Violence erupts quickly, and Xavier soon has little more to lose." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0144286/","name":"The Lost Son","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzE5MjE2ODUwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODgwNjcxMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Xavier Lombard is a world-weary private eye in London, in exile from his native Paris; his best friend is Nathalie, a high-class call girl. He gets a call from an old friend from the Paris police department, now a businessman whose b","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0144286/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"angelwild18"},"dateCreated":"2007-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"An excellent "Flic" - French Cop-Style Thriller","reviewBody":"I just watched this film on DVD, and sought it out because I love Daniel Auteil's acting.

This film felt very French to me in its cinematography and overall styling, although largely London based, and shot mainly in English. 

The acting throughout was excellent, perhaps with the exception of Ciaran Hinds' Brazilian/American/Irish accent! Ciaran plays the lost son's brother in law, who brings Lombard, the French private detective living in London, in to try to solve the case of the disappearance.

The film does deal with a very sensitive subject, but I felt it did so sensitively, showing how an empire can be brought down by one man, if he feels strongly enough to sacrifice everything he has.

There are some very violent scenes, and they are wholly central to the script, highlighting how low Lombard's character, is brought by his passion and anger at what horrors he has uncovered in a paedophile ring, involved in the disappearance of the lost son. Lombard makes moral decisions throughout the film that are understandable and I feel that this is a very powerful film.

The late Katrin Cartlidge puts in a very strong performance, supporting Lombard's character in his ultimate revenge plot. Lombard's "tart with a heart" best friend, Marianne Denicourt, is excellent in a stunning bitter-sweet role, and Billie Whitelaw is fabulous as the stern, businesslike matriarch, whose lost son is being sought by Lombard, and who also comes to terms with tragic loss, as Lombard also must. Auteuil, as always, is credible, beautiful and gives a very moving performance. Although it took me a few minutes to get over his English "voice"!

In my opinion, this must be one of the best international, cross-over, thrillers in recent years.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1488,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1999-04-21","keywords":"private investigator,pedophilia,boy,sexual abuse,child prostitution","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000809/","name":"Daniel Auteuil"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000176/","name":"Nastassja Kinski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001020/","name":"Katrin Cartlidge"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0579580/","name":"Chris Menges"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103757/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103532/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0496226/","name":"Eric Leclere"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0112127/","name":"Margaret Leclere"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0590105/","name":"Mark Mills"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Proste rzeczy: Directed by Grzegorz Zariczny. With Blazej Kitowski, Magdalena Sztorc, Tomasz Schimscheiner, Alicja Kitowska. programme.title: Callas i Pasolini - historia miłości niemożliwej
programme.desc: Opowieść o współpracy i życiu osobistym dwojga słynnych twórców. Rok 1969. Pier Paolo Pasolini realizuje film, którego fabuła osnuta jest wokół losów Medei. Odtwórczynią roli głównej jest Maria Callas. Wydarzenie to staje się punktem wyjścia do przedstawienia relacji kontrowersyjnego reżysera z największą diwą operową tamtych czasów. Opowiedzą o tym m.in. współtwórcy pamiętnego filmu.

programme.title: Dark Places
Mroczny zakątek
Dark Places
programme.desc:
Dark Places: Directed by Gilles Paquet-Brenner. With Charlize Theron, Sterling Jerins, Nicholas Hoult, Christina Hendricks. Libby Day was only eight years old when her family was brutally murdered in their rural Kansas farmhouse. Almost thirty years later, she reluctantly agrees to revisit the crime and uncovers the wrenching truths that led up to that tragic night." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2402101/","name":"Dark Places","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY1NTM4ODYzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTY2NDIwNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Libby Day was only eight years old when her family was brutally murdered in their rural Kansas farmhouse. Almost thirty years later, she reluctantly agrees to revisit the crime and uncovers the wrenching truths that led up to that tr","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2402101/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"locatordave"},"dateCreated":"2015-08-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"shine your light on Dark Places","reviewBody":"I didn't care much for Gone Girl -- maybe it was Ben Affleck -- but I was drawn to this movie despite that. Maybe it was Charlize Theron, maybe it was Nicholas Hoult, whom I have enjoyed watching grow into a first rate actor since his days in Skins. In any case, whatever reservations I had at first rapidly dissolved into a distant memory as the first ten minutes passed.

Usually I roll my eyes at flashback-driven efforts, but not so with Dark Places. Each switch back to 1985 is like the tumblers on a lock giving that satisfying click as you pick it, breeding anticipation and certainty that there is a rich reward at the end for your efforts, every scene evoking a subtle revelation that drives the story onward.

Well cast, well scored, well directed, Dark Places deserves more recognition than it has garnered. Almost thirty years later, she reluctantly agrees to revisit the crime and uncovers the wrenching truths that led up to that tragic night." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2402101/","name":"Dark Places","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY1NTM4ODYzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTY2NDIwNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Libby Day was only eight years old when her family was brutally murdered in their rural Kansas farmhouse. Almost thirty years later, she reluctantly agrees to revisit the crime and uncovers the wrenching truths that led up to that tr","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2402101/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"locatordave","dateCreated":"2015-08-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"shine your light on Dark Places","reviewBody":"I didn't care much for Gone Girl -- maybe it was Ben Affleck -- but I was drawn to this movie despite that. Maybe it was Charlize Theron, maybe it was Nicholas Hoult, whom I have enjoyed watching grow into a first rate actor since his days in Skins. In any case, whatever reservations I had at first rapidly dissolved into a distant memory as the first ten minutes passed.

Usually I roll my eyes at flashback-driven efforts, but not so with Dark Places. Each switch back to 1985 is like the tumblers on a lock giving that satisfying click as you pick it, breeding anticipation and certainty that there is a rich reward at the end for your efforts, every scene evoking a subtle revelation that drives the story onward.

programme.title: Largo Winch
Largo Winch
programme.desc:
Largo Winch: Directed by Jérôme Salle. With Tomer Sisley, Kristin Scott Thomas, Predrag 'Miki' Manojlovic, Mélanie Thierry. After a powerful billionaire is murdered, his secret adoptive son must race to prove his legitimacy, find his father's killers, and stop them from taking over his financial empire." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0808339/","name":"Largo Winch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2MTY4OTkwOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzg2NjM5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a powerful billionaire is murdered, his secret adoptive son must race to prove his legitimacy, find his father's killers, and stop them from taking over his financial empire.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0808339/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Boba_Fett1138"},"dateCreated":"2011-11-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Really well made but with an average story and some weak acting.","reviewBody":"This movie is a real mixed big. On the other hand it's one great looking and well directed movie, with a pleasant pace and some good action but on the other it's being a real average one with its story and suffers from some weak acting as well.

It's actually a movie based on a Belgian novel- and comic-book-series. And it's not really hard to see why they wanted to turn it into a movie-series as well. It has a very typical movie style and way of storytelling to it, that reminds you of movie-series such as the Bourne Identity and James Bond ones. It has a thriller type of plot, hot women, plenty of action and hand-to-hand combat and some exotic locations as well. Yet as a movie this one does not really work out quite successfully. Also financially it was a disappointment but that didn't prevent them from making a sequel, with the poetic title "Largo Winch II", in 2011, which was not much of a success either. So it seems that the series is already over before anybody had really heard about it, unless some big Hollywood studio decides to pick it up and turn it into a movie-series, since the potential is all definitely still present in it.

It's a movie in which a secretly adopted son has to proof his legitimacy, in order to take over his murdered father's company, that is worth billions and prevent it from falling in the wrong hands of some shady business people. Doesn't sound like the most interesting perhaps and you're right to think so. It's mostly being a Industrial espionage thriller, with backstabbing characters and ones with double agendas, with some action thrown in it to spice up things. It just isn't really the most exciting concept to begin with and besides, the movie its story offers little new or surprising really. It all has been done before and better as well. It's all quite predictable, also in the way it's progressing.

But the film-makers didn't seemed to be stopped in their ambitions to still create a great movie, despite of its story. It's a real slick looking movie, with a great visual style to it. They also handled the action really well, with some good camera-work and nimble editing. I'm a fan of some good old fashioned hand-to-hand action and this movie has plenty of that. Really, I can't say anything bad about the directing approach of this movie. It also provides the movie with a pleasantly fast pace, which ensures that the movie, despite of its story, won't ever start to bore you.

And the movie also needed a fast pace, since it seemed to be covering lots of ground. It's set in many different countries, at many different places, with many different people. Yet they managed to fit it all into a 100 minutes short movie. It might cause you to loose track at times though. I mean, it's quite hard to understand at times why our main character is suddenly in a different country or how he got there in the first place.

But something that really truly brings this movie down is its acting. Most of the actors really got poorly cast in this and seem to belong on TV or soap operas only really. Kristin Scott Thomas is an exception and Benedict Wong also does a decent enough job but the rest were really struggling to get their lines out convincingly. Perhaps this was also partly due to it that most characters have to speak in many different languages. The movie mostly consists out of French, English and Serbian dialog, while some of the actors themselves aren't even French, English or Serbian. And hearing a French person utter some English words just never really sounds convincing. The lead actor Tomer Sisley was also really struggling with this and only seemed to be in his element during the action sequences.

Not a great movie by any means but still worth giving a go when you have run out of anything else to watch.

6/10

programme.title: Interstate 60: Episodes of the Road
Ale jazda!
Interstate 60: Episodes of the Road
programme.desc:
Interstate 60: Episodes of the Road: Directed by Bob Gale. With Matthew Edison, Paul Brogren, Wayne Robson, Gary Oldman. Neal Oliver, a very confused young man and an artist, takes a journey of a lifetime on a highway I60 that doesn't exist on any of the maps, going to the places he never even heard of, searching for an answer and his dreamgirl." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0165832/","name":"Interstate 60: Episodes of the Road","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDYwYzlhOTAtNDAwMC00ZTBhLWI4M2QtMTA1NmJhYTdiNTkxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM0NTU5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Neal Oliver, a very confused young man and an artist, takes a journey of a lifetime on a highway I60 that doesn't exist on any of the maps, going to the places he never even heard of, searching for an answer and his dreamgirl.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0165832/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"scooterbrowne"},"dateCreated":"2004-01-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Say What You Mean and Mean What You Say (Possible Spoilers)","reviewBody":"From the man, Bob Gale, that gave us the Back to The Future trilogy comes Interstate 60. A story that everyone can pretty much relate to.

Well I say that this is one of the best movies that I have ever seen and I mean that 100%. This movie relates so much to life and shows you the results of the decisions that you make.

I waited so long to see this that I marked on my calender the day it would come out on DVD so I could go rent it at my local video store. When I first started watching it I wasn't to sure about it but by the time it was over I was sitting there amazed that a movie this good couldn't find distribution for so long and had to be put out as a direct to video release, especially with all the crap being put out at the theaters. I also couldn't wait to watch it again so I went out and bought it.

I thought the story was really good though I think the language was over the top. To me this movie was basically what everyone goes through in life. Finding that dream girl/guy, drugs, pressure from a parent/guardian,and wanting an answer to life.

The actors did a great job and Chris Cooper was hysterical. Amy Smart was hilarious when first introduced and Christopher Lloyd reminded me of his character in the Back to The Future movies.

If you need to see a thought provoking non-stop fun movie then please hop in your car and take the road less traveled down Interstate 60.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31453,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-10","keywords":"road trip,alternate reality,magic 8 ball,road movie,time warp","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Teaser Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3079324441","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg3NjM3NDEtMzJiMi00MTgxLTk0ZTEtNDc4OTU5N2M0ODkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg3NjM3NDEtMzJiMi00MTgxLTk0ZTEtNDc4OTU5N2M0ODkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","description":"Neal Oliver, a very confused young man and an artist, takes a journey of a lifetime on a highway I60 that doesn't exist on any of the maps, going to the places he never even heard of, searching for an answer and his dreamgirl."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005188/","name":"James Marsden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000198/","name":"Gary Oldman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000621/","name":"Kurt Russell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301826/","name":"Bob Gale"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022335/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040305/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0039180/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301826/","name":"Bob Gale"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

With Matthew Edison, Paul Brogren, Wayne Robson, Gary Oldman. Neal Oliver, a very confused young man and an artist, takes a journey of a lifetime on a highway I60 that doesn't exist on any of the maps, going to the places he never even heard of, searching for an answer and his dreamgirl." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0165832/","name":"Interstate 60: Episodes of the Road","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDYwYzlhOTAtNDAwMC00ZTBhLWI4M2QtMTA1NmJhYTdiNTkxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM0NTU5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Neal Oliver, a very confused young man and an artist, takes a journey of a lifetime on a highway I60 that doesn't exist on any of the maps, going to the places he never even heard of, searching for an answer and his dreamgirl.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0165832/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"scooterbrowne","dateCreated":"2004-01-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Say What You Mean and Mean What You Say (Possible Spoilers)","reviewBody":"From the man, Bob Gale, that gave us the Back to The Future trilogy comes Interstate 60. A story that everyone can pretty much relate to.

Well I say that this is one of the best movies that I have ever seen and I mean that 100%. This movie relates so much to life and shows you the results of the decisions that you make.

I waited so long to see this that I marked on my calender the day it would come out on DVD so I could go rent it at my local video store. When I first started watching it I wasn't to sure about it but by the time it was over I was sitting there amazed that a movie this good couldn't find distribution for so long and had to be put out as a direct to video release, especially with all the crap being put out at the theaters. I also couldn't wait to watch it again so I went out and bought it.

I thought the story was really good though I think the language was over the top. To me this movie was basically what everyone goes through in life. Finding that dream girl/guy, drugs, pressure from a parent/guardian,and wanting an answer to life.

The actors did a great job and Chris Cooper was hysterical. Amy Smart was hilarious when first introduced and Christopher Lloyd reminded me of his character in the Back to The Future movies.

If you need to see a thought provoking non-stop fun movie then please hop in your car and take the road less traveled down Interstate 60.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31453,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-10","keywords":"road trip,alternate reality,magic 8 ball,road movie,time warp","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Teaser Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3079324441","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg3NjM3NDEtMzJiMi00MTgxLTk0ZTEtNDc4OTU5N2M0ODkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg3NjM3NDEtMzJiMi00MTgxLTk0ZTEtNDc4OTU5N2M0ODkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","description":"Neal Oliver, a very confused young man and an artist, takes a journey of a lifetime on a highway I60 that doesn't exist on any of the maps, going to the places he never even heard of, searching for an answer and his dreamgirl.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005188/","name":"James Marsden","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000198/","name":"Gary Oldman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000621/","name":"Kurt Russell"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301826/","name":"Bob Gale"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022335/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040305/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0039180/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301826/","name":"Bob Gale"],"duration":"PT1H56M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Bob Gale

programme.title: Owning Mahowny
Hazardzista
Owning Mahowny
programme.desc: Owning Mahowny: Directed by Richard Kwietniowski. With Philip Seymour Hoffman, Minnie Driver, John Hurt, Maury Chaykin. A bank manager with: (a) a gambling problem and (b) access to a multimillion dollar account gets into a messy situation. Based on the story of the largest one-man bank fraud in Canadian history." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0285861/","name":"Owning Mahowny","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI1MDg5NDY4Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwODYxNzk5._V1_.jpg","description":"A bank manager with: (a) a gambling problem and (b) access to a multimillion dollar account gets into a messy situation. Based on the story of the largest one-man bank fraud in Canadian history.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0285861/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"andy902"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Intense! Brilliantly Acted.","reviewBody":"Phillip Seymour Hoffman is without a doubt the best independent actor making movies today. I first fell for him when he played the Jaw Dropping low life shady character Allen in Happiness, and since then his career has only gotten brighter (or darker?). He personifies "creep", and in roles like the mattress man from Punch Drunk Love, I find myself wanting to reach through the screen and strangle him. Of course, he does it again in Owning Mahoney as Dan Mahoney a young assistant manager at a Toronto bank who uses other people's funds to repay debts and feed his gambling addiction. My dissatisfaction rises as he becomes more audacious and gambles away more and more of his misbegotten cash. You will find yourself yelling "QUIT NOW!!" at the screen, but his only reply will be "but i just got here". Dan Mahoney is possibly the simplest and most complex character I've seen Hoffman tackle. Is it the love of gambling that drives him to play $70,000 hands?? No, his facial expressions don't change from when he's up 9 million, to when he's gambled away his last $500 chip. His addiction has no purpose, it's almost as if he is doing this simply to survive. Hoffman wasn't the only gem in this picture, he was coupled with Minnie Driver who was almost unidentifiable with her dark rimmed glasses and bleached blonde hair (and not a bad Canadian accent eh?). It's too bad this film will probably only be seen by true independent film/Hoffman fans because it's intense and gripping. A slice of someone's life destroyed by addiction, this is a must see!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13224,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2003-09-25","keywords":"gambling,embezzlement,atlantic city new jersey,gambling debt,gambling casino","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Owning Mahowny","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2661220633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWNhYTBlMGItNGRiOS00ZWI3LWIyYTgtMmQ4ZjFlODA4NDk0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWNhYTBlMGItNGRiOS00ZWI3LWIyYTgtMmQ4ZjFlODA4NDk0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Sony Pictures Classics"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000450/","name":"Philip Seymour Hoffman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000378/","name":"Minnie Driver"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000457/","name":"John Hurt"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0477193/","name":"Richard Kwietniowski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142812/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016350/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1150736/","name":"Gary Stephen Ross"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0995925/","name":"Maurice Chauvet"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mermaids
Syreny
Mermaids
programme.desc:
Mermaids: Directed by Richard Benjamin. With Cher, Bob Hoskins, Winona Ryder, Michael Schoeffling. An unconventional single mother relocates with her two daughters to a small Massachusetts town in 1963, where a number of events and relationships both challenge and strengthen their familial bonds." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0100140/","name":"Mermaids","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTRiNjIwYjAtZWZmNC00Y2ZmLTk3ODgtMTBmNDRlYzNiOGQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzc5MjA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unconventional single mother relocates with her two daughters to a small Massachusetts town in 1963, where a number of events and relationships both challenge and strengthen their familial bonds.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0100140/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"budmassey"},"dateCreated":"2001-03-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"A magic potion!","reviewBody":"A delightful period piece set appropriately in 1963. Appropriate because Charlotte (Wynona Ryder), like the nation, is about to shed a little of her innocence and face some difficult realities. Cher, Ryder and an adorably young Christina Ricci are perfect as a single parent family. Cher, in her best work ever, including Moonstruck, is a free-spirited mom who only cooks finger food because anything else is too much of a commitment. Ryder, who narrates the film from her character's perspective, is a high school student who, despite her fervent wish to lead a devout life, falls in love with the local handyman. Ricci is the youngest, a champion swimmer who steals the whole movie with scenes like her pumpkin scene. (Watch it and you'll know what I'm talking about. It's unforgettable.) Bob Hoskins is hilarious as the shoe salesman who falls head over heels for Cher, family and all.

Set in coastal Massachusetts, the scenery is breathtaking, and the idyllic depiction of life in a small town in the last days of American innocence is dead on. Director Richard Benjamin, who also gave us such charming films as Milk Money and My Stepmother is an Alien, rivals Penny Marshall and Rob Reiner with this gem.

This film is perfection, an absolute 10. It's a magic potion that can make me laugh and feel good even on the worst day. I sometimes wish I could step inside a la Pleasantville and stay there.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":30462,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1990-12-14","keywords":"single mother,swimming pool,year 1964,female protagonist,teenage girl","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4065770265","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2I5MmM5YzAtOGYxZS00Y2YxLWIxZjUtMTliNjFkNGFlODNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXJoYW5uYWg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2I5MmM5YzAtOGYxZS00Y2YxLWIxZjUtMTliNjFkNGFlODNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXJoYW5uYWg@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000333/","name":"Cher"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001364/","name":"Bob Hoskins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000213/","name":"Winona Ryder"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000907/","name":"Richard Benjamin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0001995/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0200351/","name":"Patty Dann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731293/","name":"June Roberts"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

An unconventional single mother relocates with her two daughters to a small Massachusetts town in 1963, where a number of events and relationships both challenge and strengthen their familial bonds." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0100140/","name":"Mermaids","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTRiNjIwYjAtZWZmNC00Y2ZmLTk3ODgtMTBmNDRlYzNiOGQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzc5MjA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unconventional single mother relocates with her two daughters to a small Massachusetts town in 1963, where a number of events and relationships both challenge and strengthen their familial bonds.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0100140/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"budmassey","dateCreated":"2001-03-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"A magic potion!","reviewBody":"A delightful period piece set appropriately in 1963. Appropriate because Charlotte (Wynona Ryder), like the nation, is about to shed a little of her innocence and face some difficult realities. Cher, Ryder and an adorably young Christina Ricci are perfect as a single parent family. Cher, in her best work ever, including Moonstruck, is a free-spirited mom who only cooks finger food because anything else is too much of a commitment. Ryder, who narrates the film from her character's perspective, is a high school student who, despite her fervent wish to lead a devout life, falls in love with the local handyman. Ricci is the youngest, a champion swimmer who steals the whole movie with scenes like her pumpkin scene. (Watch it and you'll know what I'm talking about. It's unforgettable.) Bob Hoskins is hilarious as the shoe salesman who falls head over heels for Cher, family and all.

Set in coastal Massachusetts, the scenery is breathtaking, and the idyllic depiction of life in a small town in the last days of American innocence is dead on. Director Richard Benjamin, who also gave us such charming films as Milk Money and My Stepmother is an Alien, rivals Penny Marshall and Rob Reiner with this gem.

This film is perfection, an absolute 10. It's a magic potion that can make me laugh and feel good even on the worst day. I sometimes wish I could step inside a la Pleasantville and stay there.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":30462,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1990-12-14","keywords":"single mother,swimming pool,year 1964,female protagonist,teenage girl","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4065770265","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2I5MmM5YzAtOGYxZS00Y2YxLWIxZjUtMTliNjFkNGFlODNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXJoYW5uYWg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2I5MmM5YzAtOGYxZS00Y2YxLWIxZjUtMTliNjFkNGFlODNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXJoYW5uYWg@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000333/","name":"Cher","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001364/","name":"Bob Hoskins","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000213/","name":"Winona Ryder"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000907/","name":"Richard Benjamin"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0001995/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0200351/","name":"Patty Dann","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731293/","name":"June Roberts"],"duration":"PT1H50M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Richard Benjamin

Lavalantula
programme.desc:
Lavalantula: Directed by Mike Mendez. With Steve Guttenberg, Nia Peeples, Patrick Renna, Carlos Bernard. Volcanic eruptions in Los Angeles unleash a swarm of gigantic, lava-breathing tarantulas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4060576/","name":"Lavalantula","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzMTY5OTEzNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzgwODM2NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Volcanic eruptions in Los Angeles unleash a swarm of gigantic, lava-breathing tarantulas.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4060576/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sj_stewart"},"dateCreated":"2016-03-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ludicrous and idiotic but extremely entertaining","reviewBody":"This hilariously idiotic sci-fi horror TV movie from the SyFy channel, in which giant lava-breathing tarantulas are released upon Los Angeles by violent volcanic eruptions, is as completely ludicrous as it sounds.

Despite the obvious plot holes, errors, bad CGI and its lack of scientific accuracy, Lavalantula's typical separated family gets reunited in time to save the day style story, is both extremely entertaining and exceedingly scary for all those suffering from arachnophobia.

The film stars Steve Guttenberg from Police Academy and Short Circuit, as well as Nia Peeples from Pretty Little Liars.

A group of middle school kids stumble upon a chest full of incredible toys from the future. programme.title: Intruders
Intruders
programme.desc:
Intruders: Directed by Juan Carlos Fresnadillo. With Clive Owen, Carice van Houten, Daniel Brühl, Pilar López de Ayala. Two children living in different countries are visited nightly by a faceless being who wants to take possession of them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1634121/","name":"Intruders","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1ODQ4NTIyOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzIwOTUzNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two children living in different countries are visited nightly by a faceless being who wants to take possession of them.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1634121/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ma-cortes"},"dateCreated":"2012-10-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Spanish/British horror story about a desperate father who attempts to free his daughter from his deathly grip .","reviewBody":"Intruders is a horror tale of possession in which two children in two different countries are visited by the Hollow Face man who spreads fear across the globe . There's a spooky faceless monster that has been haunting the daughter of John Farrow (Clive Owen). This figure wants to steal her face as she feels he has no identity of his own . John's tried helping his daughter remedy the situation, but each night she still gets a visit from this unwelcomed friend. Things get even spookier once John sees this faceless creature. He's not sure if he's going completely crazy or not, so he installs a security camera . Though no one can see him , Hollow Face lurks in the corners, desperately desiring love but only knowing how to spread fear and hate. He creeps into the life of John Farrow after Farrow's beloved 13-year-old daughter Mia (Ella Purnell) is assaulted in their home . The line between the real and the imaginary blurs as fissures start to open within the family unit . It seems that no security measure can keep Hollow Face out . Furthermore we're initially introduced to Juan (Izán Corchero) a young Spanish boy who, on one rainy night, is attacked by a strange spectre , known as Hollow face , being helped by his mother (Pilar Gomez Ayala) . 

The picture displays mystery, suspense, shocks, grisly terror and eerie scenes when the horrific creature appears . From start to finish the terror and spooky scenes are continuous until a striking ending . The film contains horrifying and hair rising images and a sinister, mysterious atmosphere . It has a couple of twists piled on top of one central twist concerning two children in different countries who are visited nightly by a faceless being and menaced by what seems to be a supernatural presence . Good performance by Clive Owen who stars as John Farrow, a father trying to protect his 13-year-old daughter from the evil entity known as Hollow Face . The acting from Clive Owen , Carice van Houten as his wife , Daniel Bruhl as a priest , Kerry Fox as a Doctor , Hector Alterio as an old priest is much better than the script . Nicolás Casariego and Jaime Marques' screenplay does something strange by the end : it actually removes the stakes of everything that came before with its trio of revelations that at first test and then demolish any credulity the movie had built up by that point. Both of whom manage to create some interest with their dual storytelling style . However , the picture is hampered by a partially fleshed out story that is mostly lacking in horror. Director Fresnadillo throws all of that away in exchange for a terror film without scares, originality or a pulse . Colorful cinematography plenty of lights and shades by excellent cameraman Enrique Chediak . Creepy and thrilling music adjusted to the horror film by Roque Baños . 

Director Juan Carlos Fresnadillo (Intacto , 28 Weeks Later) isn't exactly a visionary director like the film bills him as, but he is good at approaching films with style and consistent moods . The director made an editing the film was a big challenge , it was a long, complex process because of the story's dual structure. The film will appeal to terror buffs but gets some decent scares with the apparition of the frightening faceless being who wants to take possession of the children.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20552,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Fantasy","Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2011-10-07","keywords":"supernatural horror,one word title,breasts,climbing a tree,flashlight","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi758030617","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQyMTI4Mzg1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzIzMjgyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQyMTI4Mzg1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzIzMjgyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two children living in different countries are visited nightly by a faceless being who wants to take possession of them. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654110/","name":"Clive Owen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0396924/","name":"Carice van Houten"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3665621/","name":"Izán Corchero"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0294379/","name":"Juan Carlos Fresnadillo"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0224298/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0287460/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071913/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0143006/","name":"Nicolás Casariego"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0549954/","name":"Jaime Marques"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

The picture displays mystery, suspense, shocks, grisly terror and eerie scenes when the horrific creature appears . From start to finish the terror and spooky scenes are continuous until a striking ending . The film contains horrifying and hair rising images and a sinister, mysterious atmosphere . It has a couple of twists piled on top of one central twist concerning two children in different countries who are visited nightly by a faceless being and menaced by what seems to be a supernatural presence . Good performance by Clive Owen who stars as John Farrow, a father trying to protect his 13-year-old daughter from the evil entity known as Hollow Face . The acting from Clive Owen , Carice van Houten as his wife , Daniel Bruhl as a priest , Kerry Fox as a Doctor , Hector Alterio as an old priest is much better than the script . Nicolás Casariego and Jaime Marques' screenplay does something strange by the end : it actually removes the stakes of everything that came before with its trio of revelations that at first test and then demolish any credulity the movie had built up by that point. Both of whom manage to create some interest with their dual storytelling style . However , the picture is hampered by a partially fleshed out story that is mostly lacking in horror. Director Fresnadillo throws all of that away in exchange for a terror film without scares, originality or a pulse . Colorful cinematography plenty of lights and shades by excellent cameraman Enrique Chediak . Creepy and thrilling music adjusted to the horror film by Roque Baños . 

Director Juan Carlos Fresnadillo (Intacto , 28 Weeks Later) isn't exactly a visionary director like the film bills him as, but he is good at approaching films with style and consistent moods . The director made an editing the film was a big challenge , it was a long, complex process because of the story's dual structure. The film will appeal to terror buffs but gets some decent scares with the apparition of the frightening faceless being who wants to take possession of the children.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20552,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Fantasy","Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2011-10-07","keywords":"supernatural horror,one word title,breasts,climbing a tree,flashlight","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi758030617","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQyMTI4Mzg1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzIzMjgyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQyMTI4Mzg1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzIzMjgyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two children living in different countries are visited nightly by a faceless being who wants to take possession of them. ","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654110/","name":"Clive Owen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0396924/","name":"Carice van Houten","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3665621/","name":"Izán Corchero"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0294379/","name":"Juan Carlos Fresnadillo"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0224298/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0287460/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071913/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0143006/","name":"Nicolás Casariego","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0549954/","name":"Jaime Marques"],"duration":"PT1H40M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Juan Carlos Fresnadillo

programme.title: Pitch Black
Pitch Black
programme.desc:
Pitch Black: Directed by David Twohy. With Vin Diesel, Radha Mitchell, Cole Hauser, Keith David. A commercial transport ship and its crew are marooned on a planet full of bloodthirsty creatures that only come out to feast at night. But then, they learn that a month-long eclipse is about to occur." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0134847/","name":"Pitch Black","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTNmYzE1OWYtZDdjNC00OTdhLTg1YjUtYWJlZTVkMzkzNmVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A commercial transport ship and its crew are marooned on a planet full of bloodthirsty creatures that only come out to feast at night. But then, they learn that a month-long eclipse is about to occur.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0134847/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mstomaso"},"dateCreated":"2006-09-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Relentless and gorgeous sci-fi action film","reviewBody":"Let me waste a moment of your time to explain how I approached this film. 1st I dismissed the trailers out of hand because the film appeared to be an uncredited remake of Aliens, which I consider to be one of the weakest films in the Alien series. Stupidly continuing to dismiss the film after I heard positive things about it from people whose opinions I trust, I missed the theatrical run completely. I then became hooked on Farscape, in its 3rd or 4th season at the time, and found Pitch Black on cable one night around bed time - so I said "oh why not, at least it has Claudia Black in it." Soon, I recognized Keith David, and began to realize that Vin Diesel, Radha Mitchell and Cole Hauser could all act (why this should surprise me, I do not know). I was captivated. I have now remained captivated for four years. I just watched the film for the 3rd or 4th time, and I still love it.

This is not an art film, not an independent, and its not entirely original, but where it fails to break a lot of new ground, it utterly succeeds in providing interesting, realistic characters, hard-driving action in the medium of a compelling but simple plot, and non-stop entertainment; an absolutely beautiful environment with tastefully rendered special effects. Sound to good to be true? Don't take my word for it... see it for yourself.

The film also highlighted the charisma of the now somewhat iconoclastic Vin Diesel, introducing the character of Richard Riddick. Diesel would go on to star in the somewhat Riddick-ulous Chronicles thereof (which I also enjoyed, though recognizing its rather huge flaws) and is now something of a legend. Diesel is so charismatic, so big, and so interesting to watch that it is easy to ignore the fact that he is not only a talented actor, but a smart one too. Checking out the DVD version of Pitch Black, with the audio comments on might just blow you away.

The film is about the crew of an inter-system transport ship stranded on an unknown planet after a crash-landing in which their captain was killed. The new commander is inexperienced but bright and heroic (Mitchell), but she is caught between two dominant and dangerous personalities - a bounty hunter with secrets (Hauser) and a dangerous criminal who has been surgically altered to see in the dark (Diesel). Is that all? Of course not - the planet is inhabited, and the inhabitants are hungry.

As unoriginal and improbable as some of this may be, Pitch Black is beautifully filmed, well told, and very nicely performed. Don't expect to learn anything, and don't expect to have to think a whole lot, but do expect to have fun with this modern sci-fi action classic.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":232514,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2000-02-18","keywords":"darkness,desert,eclipse,survival,spaceship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Pitch Black","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi15073561","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWJiYzFiZDMtZTUwZi00ZWVlLTg1OTQtODA3NWQ4MDIwNjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWJiYzFiZDMtZTUwZi00ZWVlLTg1OTQtODA3NWQ4MDIwNjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0593664/","name":"Radha Mitchell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0369513/","name":"Cole Hauser"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004874/","name":"Vin Diesel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0878638/","name":"David Twohy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030612/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031772/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0923646/","name":"Jim Wheat"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003117/","name":"Ken Wheat"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0878638/","name":"David Twohy"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: A Kind of Murder
Sposób na morderstwo
A Kind of Murder
programme.desc:
A Kind of Murder: Directed by Andy Goddard. With Patrick Wilson, Jessica Biel, Haley Bennett, Eddie Marsan. In 1960s New York, Walter Stackhouse is a successful architect married to the beautiful Clara who leads a seemingly perfect life. But his fascination with an unsolved murder leads him into a spiral of chaos as he is forced to play cat-and-mouse with a clever killer and an overambitious detective, while at the same time lusting after another woman." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2726552/","name":"A Kind of Murder","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNDA1NjcwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDY0MDA2MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 1960s New York, Walter Stackhouse is a successful architect married to the beautiful Clara who leads a seemingly perfect life. But his fascination with an unsolved murder leads him into a spiral of chaos as he is forced to play ca","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2726552/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"randymcbeast"},"dateCreated":"2016-12-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Hints of De Palma but then the story ends up going nowhere","reviewBody":"This was a beautifully shot film and at points I thought I was watching a Brian De Palma film, but all of that went out south in the last ten minutes.

The story had built up nicely and I was salivating at the prospect of a wild twist of an ending. The cast and the acting were all top notch and it held up nicely as the period piece it intended to be, but then things started going haywire and it all just fell apart.

It really seemed as if the movie perhaps ran out of money in the budget and then they just slapped together some incoherent garbage and called it a day. There has to be some explanation. I mean, the first hour plus of the movie was really well done so what the heck happened? It's a shame too because with the right editing it could have been great.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7407,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2016-12-16","keywords":"movie theater,corvette,poodle,cocktail party,death of wife","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Kind of Murder","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1088141849","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NzI2ZWUtMzU4NS00NDg2LTk3NGQtMGZlZTAzNzI5YzEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NzI2ZWUtMzU4NS00NDg2LTk3NGQtMGZlZTAzNzI5YzEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for A Kind of Murder"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933940/","name":"Patrick Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004754/","name":"Jessica Biel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2247245/","name":"Haley Bennett"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0323758/","name":"Andy Goddard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030755/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5608704/","name":"Susan Boyd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0383604/","name":"Patricia Highsmith"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Found Footage 3D
Duch śmierci
Found Footage 3D
programme.desc: Found Footage 3D: Directed by Steven DeGennaro. With Carter Roy, Alena von Stroheim, Chris O'Brien, Tom Saporito. A group of filmmakers set out to make the first 3D found footage horror movie, but find themselves in a found footage horror movie when the evil entity from their film escapes into their behind-the-scenes footage." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3449006/","name":"Found Footage 3D","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgzNjcxMzE5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzU3NDc3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of filmmakers set out to make the first 3D found footage horror movie, but find themselves in a found footage horror movie when the evil entity from their film escapes into their behind-the-scenes footage.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3449006/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ConqueringRuler"},"dateCreated":"2018-05-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not the worst found footage, but also not the best..","reviewBody":"Found Footage 3D is not the worst found footage I've ever see, I dislike for example, Paranormal Activity much more, I dislike most/almost all of found footage films.. At least, here, they are self-aware and I liked that about the movie. And for me, the questions or the answer to these questions, "Why are you filming" and "Why are you keep filming when the crap hits the fan" makes a bit more sense than the usual found footage garbage. It reminded me of a horror game, with a camera, years back, some may know what I'm talking about.. Let's just say, I was pleasantly surprised with this movie, not to get total crap, as I was expecting. IMDb data; ttnr: 3449006, Title: Found Footage 3D, --- Description: Found Footage 3D: Directed by Steven DeGennaro. With Carter Roy, Alena von Stroheim, Chris O'Brien, Tom Saporito. A group of filmmakers set out to make the first 3D found footage horror movie, but find themselves in a found footage horror movie when the evil entity from their film escapes into their behind-the-scenes footage." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3449006/","name":"Found Footage 3D","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgzNjcxMzE5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzU3NDc3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of filmmakers set out to make the first 3D found footage horror movie, but find themselves in a found footage horror movie when the evil entity from their film escapes into their behind-the-scenes footage.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3449006/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ConqueringRuler","dateCreated":"2018-05-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not the worst found footage, but also not the best..","reviewBody":"Found Footage 3D is not the worst found footage I've ever see, I dislike for example, Paranormal Activity much more, I dislike most/almost all of found footage films.. At least, here, they are self-aware and I liked that about the movie. And for me, the questions or the answer to these questions, "Why are you filming" and "Why are you keep filming when the crap hits the fan" makes a bit more sense than the usual found footage garbage. It reminded me of a horror game, with a camera, years back, some may know what I'm talking about.. Let's just say, I was pleasantly surprised with this movie, not to get total crap, as I was expecting. Not bad, but still far from very good. 5/10","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2107,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror"],"datePublished":"2018-10-26","keywords":"found footage,entity,filmmaker,filmed paranormal event,movie making","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Found Footage 3D Teaser Trailer #1 (2D version)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1732818713","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzY0NjgyMTA1OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDc1MDU3OTE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzY0NjgyMTA1OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDc1MDU3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Visit http://www.foundfootage3d.com for more information and screening times.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0746957/","name":"Carter Roy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4131513/","name":"Alena von Stroheim","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3115641/","name":"Chris O'Brien"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3342252/","name":"Steven DeGennaro"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0464488/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0351724/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3342252/","name":"Steven DeGennaro"],"duration":"PT1H40M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Steven DeGennaro

programme.desc: W Bukareszcie zostaje zamordowanych kilkoro Amerykanów. Dwoje agentów CIA, Ty Griffin (Michael Paré) i Jennifer Wells (Sandra Hess), wyrusza do Rumunii, aby rozpocząć śledztwo w tej sprawie.

programme.title: Snowmageddon
Śnieżny Armagedon
Snowmageddon
programme.desc:
Snowmageddon: Directed by Sheldon Wilson. With David Cubitt, Laura Harris, Dylan Matzke, Magda Apanowicz. An Alaskan town is in danger of destruction by a mystical snow globe that appears on a family's doorstep, wrapped like a Christmas gift, and causes deadly "natural" disasters in the real world, while simultaneously occurring in the globe." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1876446/","name":"Snowmageddon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDJkNGFiYTctNmRmMi00Mzc3LWJiZWYtN2RhNDkyZWFjYTBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTY5Nzc4MDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"An Alaskan town is in danger of destruction by a mystical snow globe that appears on a family's doorstep, wrapped like a Christmas gift, and causes deadly "natural" disasters in the real world, while simultaneously occurring in the g","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1876446/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheLittleSongbird"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Another case of the not terrible but not good either sort of movie","reviewBody":"As I have said many times already I have made no secret of disliking a lot of SyFy's films, but I do keep watching to see if they do come up with something that is watchable at least. They have done a few movies that are surprisingly tolerable though even they are far from perfect, but most are bad but you are amused by the awfulness or are like witnessing a train-wreck.

I was very mixed on Snowmageddon actually, of the above categories it sits between the tolerable and so bad it's good ones. I do give it plaudits for the better than average acting, granted it is not brilliant but it is award-worthy compared to the likes of Quantum Apocalypse and Titanic II, decent photography and a storyline that is mostly interesting and original in concept.

That is not to say that the story is perfect though. It is interesting and generally well paced, but it does take a while to get going and the ending is abrupt. There are also scenes and ideas that suspend disbelief and don't make much sense, but for the first time in a while I actually got some novelty value out of them. These are including the ideas that electricity is still flowing in a town that is cut off from the rest of the world, flying even with ice bombs are going off and nobody in the town carrying a knife.

Snowmageddon also has some amateurish effects-though I've seen worse-, cheesy dialogue and characters that aren't developed enough to make us care for them. I loved the title, but it didn't fit with the concept and story, it was like there had been a last minute title change or that they had thought of a new idea and forgot to think of a title that fitted.

Overall, not as bad as other SyFy efforts, but there is nothing really that stood out to make it memorable or good. 4/10 Bethany Cox","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1159,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2011-12-10","keywords":"disaster film,globe,christmas,snow,the family","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0190931/","name":"David Cubitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0364977/","name":"Laura Harris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3676866/","name":"Dylan Matzke"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0934135/","name":"Sheldon Wilson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0337940/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0998149/","name":"Rudy Thauberger"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="
