IMDb data; ttnr: 0191666, Title: Zloto dezerterów, --- Description: Zloto dezerterów: Directed by Janusz Majewski. With Marek Kondrat, Boguslaw Linda, Wiktor Zborowski, Katarzyna Figura. During World War II a group of safe-crackers sets off on a mission to steal gold from a Nazi bank." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0191666/","name":"Zloto dezerterów","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzM4OTI4ZGUtNmQyZS00NjZiLWE4OWUtNDA3Y2RkOGE4ZTkzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"During World War II a group of safe-crackers sets off on a mission to steal gold from a Nazi bank.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0191666/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Maziun","dateCreated":"2013-08-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bad sequel to fun movie","reviewBody":"This is a sequel to movie from 1985 – HK Deserters" . The heroes from the first movie also appear here , but there is plenty of new heroes . The first movie was a war comedy about a group of friends running away from army . This one is supposed to be a war comedy about stealing gold from Nazi's.

It was supposed to be comedy . Unfortunately the movie takes itself way too seriously . The movie unnecessary tries to tell something about anti-Semitism , betrayal and courage of freedom fighters. For more than half of the movie is hard to tell that this is comedy . When the so-called jokes appear in the second half of the movie they so awful you will groan. The movie also feels too long (it's 2 hours long ) , which wasn't a problem in the first movie (which was almost 3 hours long) . Gone is the charm and the fun of original.

The acting is good and the music is very jolly . Still , it's too little to save the movie from being a disaster. I give it 1/10. Better watch "Kelly's heroes". Or the original – "HK Deserters".","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":493,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5,"genre":["Action","Comedy","War"],"datePublished":"1998-12-04","keywords":"1940s,world war two","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0464945/","name":"Marek Kondrat","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0511277/","name":"Boguslaw Linda","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953975/","name":"Wiktor Zborowski"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0538105/","name":"Janusz Majewski"],"creator":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0538105/","name":"Janusz Majewski"],"duration":"PT2H3M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Janusz Majewski

programme.desc: W cotygodniowym programie zostają przedstawione najbardziej interesujące wydarzenia ze świata kina. Pojawiają się wywiady z osobami związanymi z branżą filmową, prowadzone są rozmowy na temat premier, nowości muzycznych i teatralnych.

programme.title: Lincoln
Lincoln
programme.desc:
Lincoln: Directed by Steven Spielberg. With Daniel Day-Lewis, Sally Field, David Strathairn, Joseph Gordon-Levitt. As the American Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0443272/","name":"Lincoln","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQzNzczMDUyNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjM2ODEzOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"As the American Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0443272/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"StevePulaski"},"dateCreated":"2012-11-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A capsule of a great president and a director's increasing maturity","reviewBody":"Daniel Day-Lewis is something of an unsung miracle; the man will come out of nowhere, select an unlikely role, knock it out of the park, then quietly crawl back into the ground for the next three or four years before repeating the same process. He is an underrated talent most likely due to his lack of a prolific career, somewhat like director Terrence Malick. Here, Day-Lewis teams up with one of Hollywood's most prolific men, Steven Spielberg, who is coming off a stellar 2011, where he produced both Super 8 and Transformers: Dark of the Moon and directed both The Adventures of Tintin and War Horse, two acclaimed pictures.

Spielberg mans the camera in one of the most exhilarating biopics in recent memory. Lincoln is a stunning humanization and coloring-book job of American politics, shedding a light on the skepticism and grayness of the government during that time. To simplify the story, Spielberg chooses to focus on the political interworkings of our sixteenth president's cabinet rather than the Civil War itself. It shows the long, grating process of amending the United States' constitution for the thirteenth time to abolish slavery and grant African Americans equality, and how that more than one men stood at the center of the action when the process was taking place, along with how he was incorruptibly confident that ending the practice of slavery will lead to ending the war.

While titled "Lincoln," we get several other characters with a fairly surprising amount of screen time. Among them are Joseph Gordon-Levitt playing Lincoln's oldest son, Robert Todd, Tommy Lee Jones playing Thaddeus Stevens, the fiery Radical Republican leader who is strongly passionate about abolitionism, Sally Field as the president's devoted wife, Mary Todd, and David Strathairn as William Seward, the secretary of state. It could also be said that at times Abraham Lincoln is not writer Tony Kushner's (who also penned Spielberg's Munich, unseen by me) prime focus, as much as it is the backroom deals of the 1865 congress and the political battles and obstacles each member faced when their morals and ideology came forth in abolishing one of the most inhumane acts ever allowed in the United States.

Daniel Day-Lewis is mesmerizing here, never overplaying or shortchanging Lincoln in one of his most reliable roles yet. Here, he seems much more cinematic than his previous works, and seems to be smitten with Lincoln's character and persona as he embodies him for one-hundred and fifty minutes. His voice is not stereotypically deep manly, and guttural as many other works have made him out to be, but reedy and poetically satisfying, boasting not much more than historical records claim. Day-Lewis is only assisted by the wealth of invaluable talent he is surrounded by, yet some of the most powerful work of his career comes out when Lincoln is reciting stories or parables to a group of bewildered, yet fascinated individuals who recall and cherish every word the man is saying.

One requirement upon seeing Lincoln is you must commit to two and a half hours of dialog and monologues from several characters about several different topics. One challenge faced by the filmmakers that is inherently difficult to overcome is the wealth of information, history, and knowledge of the period, and we see the struggle they face at attempting to sum it all up into a structured, disciplined film. I could've seen this as an HBO ten to fifteen part miniseries, elaborating on smaller characters, extending the work of the amendment, and even showing Lincoln's impact on a still vulnerable United States. But such an action may have proved too heavy for even history buffs.

With this film, there is a lot going on in terms of subtleties and there is a plethora of weight that rests on the film's script that at times makes this a challenging picture to watch. I'm reminded of my recent adventure to see the Wachowski's Cloud Atlas, and how that film was beautiful, striking, and increasingly ambitious, but also maddening and occasionally tedious. I wouldn't so much call Lincoln maddening or tedious as I would challenging to stay in-tuned with.

But that does not mean I couldn't see thousands of people emerging pleased and delighted with the film they just saw. This is a richly detailed and unsurprisingly intellectual picture that will go down as one of the greatest cinematic endeavors to ever focus on American politics. Kushner and Spielberg have gone on to make quite possibly the best film we'll ever see about the passage of an amendment through congress and the exhausting compromises and deals that go along with the process. Finally, I must note Spielberg's top notch use of subversive elements from Lincoln's voice, to the focus of the picture from a narrative point of view, to the inevitable conclusion that still leaves us impacted and shaken.

Starring: Daniel Day-Lewis, Sally Field, David Strathairn, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, James Spader, Hal Holbrook, Tommy Lee Jones, and Jackie Earle Haley. Directed by: Steven Spielberg.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":253482,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2013-02-20","keywords":"based on real person,1860s,american civil war,politics,cultural conflict","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Winner: Best Actor","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi759866393","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MzYzOTY4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDE5OTA3OA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MzYzOTY4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDE5OTA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"As the Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield and as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000358/","name":"Daniel Day-Lewis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000398/","name":"Sally Field"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000657/","name":"David Strathairn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000229/","name":"Steven Spielberg"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0336601/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065785/","name":"Tony Kushner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0329447/","name":"Doris Kearns Goodwin"}],"duration":"PT2H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Thunderbolt in Mine Eye

programme.desc:
Thunderbolt in Mine Eye: Directed by Sarah Sherman, Zachary Ray Sherman. With Anjini Taneja Azhar, Quinn Liebling, Alex Jarmon, Ayla Carda. Harper enters high school and sparks a relationship with her brother's best friend, Tilly. While Harper deals with social blowback, the older Tilly is congratulated, setting up a very modern love story in the age of Time's Up and Me Too." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9170758/","name":"Thunderbolt in Mine Eye","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODVlYTM4NzYtMTZmZi00MTQxLThhMDUtNmY0OTJlNzYxNWYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjE4MDEyMzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harper enters high school and sparks a relationship with her brother's best friend, Tilly. While Harper deals with social blowback, the older Tilly is congratulated, setting up a very modern love story in the age of Time's Up and Me ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9170758/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ops-52535"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"a cute little...","reviewBody":"Story about teenagers awkwarditious and'' im humbly there for you ''-behaviour, where the butterflies shoots grains of sugar each time a smile or a kiss or even just the reckognition of attention makes everything go jelly in every joint of the body and the toungemuscles seize to work at all, yeah its the things everybody will become or have been through if old as me the grumpy old man, looking back in reminiscence.

its not a super interesting story, script wise its overuse of words like ''eehm'' and ''hey...'' drags down quality, cast young and not spangling like stars yet, but the environments and situations that the mains lives are quite fine. also overall good impression by the extras in the background, they are pretty game and seems not to be afraid of the camera lens, that shows signs of good direction.

productionwise its good filmed, sounds good, its edited quite seamless and the weedy neighbourhood locations well chosen. the musical score though is a bummer though, feeling like being in a cheap banjo climpering western scorewise. but thats my tinnitusious ears of mine...

so this is the kind of debutants dream come through, and never fails nor succeeds, , time filler yes, generic yes, original no, so therefore a small recommend from'' tgom ''.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":168,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2021-02-12","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2087698713","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNhNjgxOGUtYjA5YS00MjhjLWFjOGItMDA1ZTQ5YzZiN2M2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNhNjgxOGUtYjA5YS00MjhjLWFjOGItMDA1ZTQ5YzZiN2M2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4687572/","name":"Anjini Taneja Azhar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9089619/","name":"Quinn Liebling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7802747/","name":"Alex Jarmon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610385/","name":"Sarah Sherman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792610/","name":"Zachary Ray Sherman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0152336/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0204135/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0733339/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610385/","name":"Sarah Sherman"}],"duration":"PT1H21M"}</script><metacontent="

so this is the kind of debutants dream come through, and never fails nor succeeds, , time filler yes, generic yes, original no, so therefore a small recommend from'' tgom ''.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":168,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2021-02-12","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2087698713","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNhNjgxOGUtYjA5YS00MjhjLWFjOGItMDA1ZTQ5YzZiN2M2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNhNjgxOGUtYjA5YS00MjhjLWFjOGItMDA1ZTQ5YzZiN2M2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4687572/","name":"Anjini Taneja Azhar","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9089619/","name":"Quinn Liebling","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7802747/","name":"Alex Jarmon"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610385/","name":"Sarah Sherman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792610/","name":"Zachary Ray Sherman"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0152336/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0204135/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0733339/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610385/","name":"Sarah Sherman"],"duration":"PT1H21M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Sarah Sherman, Zachary Ray Sherman

programme.title: Trzy i pół godziny
programme.desc: Monachium, 13 sierpnia 1961 roku. Pasażerowie pociągu do Berlina Wschodniego dowiadują się o budowie muru dzielącego miasto. Do granicy dotrą za trzy i pół godziny. W tym czasie muszą podjąć decyzję, czy wysiąść, czy jechać dalej. Przed trudnym wyborem staje m.in. Marlis podróżująca z mężem Gerdem i dzieckiem.

programme.title: You May Kiss the Bridesmaid
You May Kiss the Bridesmaid
programme.desc: You May Kiss the Bridesmaid: Directed by Caroline Labrèche. With Tori Anderson, Kristopher Turner, Julia Borsellino, Sarah Orenstein. Food influencer Scarlett Bailey is presented with the opportunity of a lifetime to work as a pastry chef in one of NYC's top restaurants. Her life gets put on hold when she returns to her hometown for her sister Maddie's wedding. Scarlett learns that her parents have sold the family home, a B&B, to her childhood flame Liam Perry and that Maddie has lost her wedding venue days before the nuptials. Scarlett suggests they host the event at the B&B and works with Liam to pull off the wedding of Maddie's dreams, trying to put their history behind them. As her dream job in NYC becomes a firm offer, Scarlett is forced to make a decision. She has been falling back in love with Liam and with her childhood home. With the countdown to the wedding day on, will Liam Perry get to kiss the bridesmaid?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12829388/","name":"You May Kiss the Bridesmaid","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWI3MTQwNzgtYmIzNy00YWI3LWIxMGEtYmE5YmU1YmVmN2RmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk1NzUwMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Food influencer Scarlett Bailey is presented with the opportunity of a lifetime to work as a pastry chef in one of NYC's top restaurants. The Devil Has a Name
programme.desc: The Devil Has a Name: Directed by Edward James Olmos. With Kate Bosworth, Chivonne Michelle, Katie Lynn McDowell, Alfred Molina. A psychotic oil matriarch leaves the whole industry exposed when she attempts to outfight a bullish farmer whose water has been poisoned." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7894510/","name":"The Devil Has a Name","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM3ZmNhMTgtOGI1Mi00ZThjLWIwYjctMmQzYjliYjIwNzZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQwMTY2Nzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A psychotic oil matriarch leaves the whole industry exposed when she attempts to outfight a bullish farmer whose water has been poisoned.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7894510/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"roger_2020"},"dateCreated":"2020-10-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very Bad movie","reviewBody":"The production looks rushed and cheap and the image-quality looks like it's right out of first semester of film school. programme.title: A Good Day to Die Hard
Szklana pułapka 5
A Good Day to Die Hard
programme.desc:
A Good Day to Die Hard: Directed by John Moore. With Bruce Willis, Jai Courtney, Sebastian Koch, Mary Elizabeth Winstead. John McClane travels to Russia to help out his seemingly wayward son, Jack, only to discover that Jack is a CIA operative working undercover, causing the father and son to team up against underworld forces." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1606378/","name":"A Good Day to Die Hard","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwNzgyNzUzOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzAwOTA5OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"John McClane travels to Russia to help out his seemingly wayward son, Jack, only to discover that Jack is a CIA operative working undercover, causing the father and son to team up against underworld forces.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1606378/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"illbebackreviews"},"dateCreated":"2013-02-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Good Day For This Franchise to Die Hard","reviewBody":"Now, I'm a fan of the first three movies. I love them really a lot, especially the original but I also love the 3rd installment, mainly due to the chemistry between Jackson and Willis. That was phenomenal. I could not connect with much in the 4th movie as it was a lot of CGI and made John McClane a superhero who seemed invincible. I wasn't setting my standards high for this one at all as I knew what it could turn out to be, but BOY...This movie really is awful 

This movie is based around John McClane who travels to Russia to deal with his son's issues. There, a whole lot of crap begins to happen. This movie attempts to have such a complex plot for a Die Hard whereas the other four were so simple that even the dumbest person could tell what was happening. Its like this director, the guy who made the god awful Max Payne thought that the plot had to be complex for an action film like Die Hard As a regular movie, this movie may NOT be that bad but as a Die Hard movie, it is god awful. I couldn't bear to watch the pain that I went through in this film, why? Because, almost nothing in this movie resembled anything about Die Hard. There was no tone, no tension and as a result, it felt nothing like Die Hard. NOTHING! 

The characters really are all awful, with the exception of John McClane who still has a bit of relatability to him. Bruce Willis does a fantastic job in the movie but every other member of the cast really didn't appeal to me. The villain was weak, John's son was uninteresting and a lame addition to the franchise, as if he were there to sell action figures. The story was no fun and the action was all messy This movie does absolutely nothing to resemble the Die Hard films and as such, one of the most anticipated movies of 2013 has fallen down a drain with overuse of CGI, lame characters and plot, uninteresting villain with no real intention and another excuse to make more money out of it.

A Good day to Die Hard is a movie that makes you think that this day is a good day for you to die hard. Do not watch it, pointless action movie that does not resemble Die Hard.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":203162,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-02-14","keywords":"john mcclane character,repeat sequel,subjective camera,john f. kennedy international airport,taxi","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Version #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1541121817","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE4OTExMjg4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzUyMzE5OA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE4OTExMjg4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzUyMzE5OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"John McClane travels to Russia to help out his seemingly wayward son, Jack, only to discover that Jack is a CIA operative working to prevent a nuclear-weapons heist, causing the father and son to team up against underworld forces. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000246/","name":"Bruce Willis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2541974/","name":"Jai Courtney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0462407/","name":"Sebastian Koch"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0601382/","name":"John Moore"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0420822/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129985/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0940790/","name":"Skip Woods"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0861636/","name":"Roderick Thorp"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto
Polański, Horowitz. Hometown
programme.desc: Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto: Directed by Mateusz Kudla, Anna Kokoszka-Romer. With Roman Polanski, Ryszard Horowitz, Bronislawa Horowitz Karakulska, Stanislaw Buchala. Roman Polanski and Ryszard Horowitz came to Poland to share with us the most personal memories from their childhood and youth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8546414/","name":"Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg0NmQ3NmEtY2NkOC00ZmI2LTg3YmUtNTc2MGEwNWQ2OWFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk5MjEzMTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Roman Polanski and Ryszard Horowitz came to Poland to share with us the most personal memories from their childhood and youth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8546414/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"belenus-133-722656"},"dateCreated":"2021-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very moving true strory.","reviewBody":"This is a beautiful documentary. It takes you right into the heart of the darkest period in the 20th century, right into the heart of a Holocaust - Krakow in Poland, where the famous Plaszow ghetto was located and where the trains were loaded for Auschwitz. It's also a very intimate and moving portrait of a true friendship between two great artists. We get to see incredible suffering but also have a chance to witness a fantastic sense of humour, which obviously is the best way to deal with such sad memories. We can also now understand why Polanski refused to film "The Shindler's List" and instead filmed "The Pianist". We should be very grateful to film authors. PS - People who give this film a low rating obviously have not seen it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2021-08-20","keywords":"childhood","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000591/","name":"Roman Polanski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1058543/","name":"Ryszard Horowitz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7061785/","name":"Bronislawa Horowitz Karakulska"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8896961/","name":"Mateusz Kudla"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9896989/","name":"Anna Kokoszka-Romer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0701909/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9896989/","name":"Anna Kokoszka-Romer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8896961/","name":"Mateusz Kudla"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ophelia
Ofelia
Ophelia
programme.desc: Ophelia: Directed by Claire McCarthy. With Daisy Ridley, Mia Quiney, Calum O'Rourke, Nathaniel Parker. A reimagining of Hamlet, told from Ophelia's perspective." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5690810/","name":"Ophelia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2OTAxNjI2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzc2NjUwODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A reimagining of Hamlet, told from Ophelia's perspective.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5690810/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tgraykgray"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cannot always trust critics.","reviewBody":"Possibly because Hamlet is my favourite Shakespeare play, this film held me totally. Almost put off by other people's opinions,thank fully decided for myself. This was very clever,and holding. No two share fully the same views,but I am glad that to mine own self I was true. A haunting film,and I will never watch Hamlet in the same way again. Funny that it was so well received in Russia. TGray","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9673,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-06-28","keywords":"shakespeare's hamlet,gertrude character,ophelia character,title directed by female,denmark","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3975527449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWQ4NmM0ODQtMDZkNS00NTYwLTgzNzQtMzBmZjVkY2FiM2I2XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWQ4NmM0ODQtMDZkNS00NTYwLTgzNzQtMzBmZjVkY2FiM2I2XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in the 14th Century, 'Ophelia' is a re-imagining of Shakespeare's "Hamlet." Ophelia (Daisy Ridley) takes center stage as Queen Gertrude's (Naomi Watts) most trusted lady-in-waiting. Beautiful and intelligent, she soon captures the attention of the handsome Prince Hamlet (George MacKay) and a forbidden love blossoms. As war brews, lust and betrayal are tearing Elsinore Castle apart from within and Ophelia must decide between her true love or her own life in order to protect a very dangerous secret."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5397459/","name":"Daisy Ridley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6731603/","name":"Mia Quiney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9058955/","name":"Calum O'Rourke"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2113122/","name":"Claire McCarthy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0551691/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0207528/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0457787/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155069/","name":"Semi Chellas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8120239/","name":"Lisa Klein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000636/","name":"William Shakespeare"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wyzwanie - nowe mieszkanie 10
programme.desc: Program prezentuje najnowsze i najciekawsze oferty na rynku nieruchomości. Ekipa dąży do tego, by każdy z uczestników znalazł swoje upragnione cztery kąty - zarówno ci, którzy szukają lokum w centrum miasta, jak i ci, którzy marzą o spokojnym mieszkaniu z dala od zgiełku i chaosu. Prowadzący postara się, by każda oferta była dostosowana do wymagań bohaterów i spełniała ich najbardziej skrywane pragnienia.

programme.desc: Piotr Kucharski pokaże widzom, jak przełamać kulinarną rutynę i sprawić, by gotowanie było przyjemne, a jego efekt - smaczny.

programme.title: News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

programme.title: Tenis: Turniej WTA Finals w Guadalajarze
programme.desc: Miłośnik gotowania i podróży, Paweł Paszek-Pietruch, odwiedza najciekawsze rejony Polski. Szuka nie tylko adrenaliny, ale i nowych smaków. W trakcie dwudniowej wyprawy musi przetrwać z dala od cywilizacji. Nie zważając na nieprzyjazne warunki, próbuje zrealizować wyznaczony na początku cel. Po drodze przyjdzie mu nocować w opuszczonej chacie czy bacówce. Umiejętności survivalowe pozwolą mu nie tylko znaleźć schronienie, ale i przygotować posiłek.

programme.title: Piłka nożna: Liga francuska - podsumowanie sezonu 2020/21
programme.desc: Miłośnik gotowania i podróży, Paweł Paszek-Pietruch, odwiedza najciekawsze rejony Polski. Szuka nie tylko adrenaliny, ale i nowych smaków. W trakcie dwudniowej wyprawy musi przetrwać z dala od cywilizacji. Nie zważając na nieprzyjazne warunki, próbuje zrealizować wyznaczony na początku cel. Po drodze przyjdzie mu nocować w opuszczonej chacie czy bacówce. Umiejętności survivalowe pozwolą mu nie tylko znaleźć schronienie, ale i przygotować posiłek.

programme.title: 365 obiadów Mariety Mareckiej
programme.desc: Gospodyni programu podpowiada, skąd czerpać inspiracje na codzienne obiady. Marieta Marecka zaprezentuje szereg prostych posiłków. W każdym odcinku zaprezentuje trzy nowe, często zaskakujące potrawy.

programme.title: Czy na pewno umiesz gotować?
programme.desc: Mistrzowie domowej kuchni poznają prawdę o swoim kulinarnym talencie. Bohaterem każdego odcinka jest osoba zgłoszona przez rodzinę. Każdy myśli, że został wybrany ze względu na swoje zdolności. Tymczasem okazuje się, że bliscy mają już dość przesolonej lasagne, mdłej pomidorówki lub twardych schabowych, ale boją się powiedzieć to wprost kucharzowi amatorowi. Znany szef kuchni Andrzej Polan ocenia umiejętności swoich gości i pomaga im podszkolić się w trudnej sztuce gotowania.

credits.actor: Andrzej Polan

programme.title: Rośliny Karoliny
programme.desc: Karolina Kudłacik, miłośniczka roślinności i specjalistka w dziedzinie projektowania ogrodów, udowadnia, że w każdej przestrzeni można stworzyć coś wyjątkowego. Prowadząca uwielbia rzeczy używane.

programme.title: Rośliny Karoliny
programme.desc: Karolina Kudłacik, miłośniczka roślinności i specjalistka w dziedzinie projektowania ogrodów, udowadnia, że w każdej przestrzeni można stworzyć coś wyjątkowego. Prowadząca uwielbia rzeczy używane.

programme.title: Remont w 48h 2
programme.desc: Tomasz Pągowski odwiedza ludzi, którzy chcieliby zrobić w swoim mieszkaniu remont, ale boją się kosztów i utrudniających życie prac. Architekt udowodni im, że metamorfozę wnętrz można przeprowadzić szybko i tanio.

programme.title: Odyseja po greckich wyspach
A Greek Odyssey with Bettany Hughes
News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

programme.title: Mistrzowie przekąsek w akcji 2
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix po raz kolejny sprawdzi, jak szefowie kuchni poradzą sobie z rzuconymi przez niego wyzwaniami. Zadaniem uczestników programu będzie przygotowanie przekąsek, które uwielbiają Brytyjczycy. Ich pracę ocenią pracownicy fabryk, w których produkuje się dany przysmak.

programme.title: Na cenzurowanym
Master of the Classe
programme.desc: Berry (Sébastien Chassagne) ma 35 lat i dopiero niedawno dostał pracę jako stażysta w gimnazjum. Jego marzenie o stabilnym zatrudnieniu zostaje poddane próbie. Pewnego dnia ma się odbyć inspekcja jego lekcji, której wynik zadecyduje o tym, czy mężczyzna zdobędzie stałą posadę.

credits.actor: Sébastien Chassagne
Séverine Poupin

programme.title: O włos
Pile poil
programme.desc: Elodie (Madeleine Baudot) cały wolny czas poświęca pomagając ojcu (GrégoryGadebois) w sklepie mięsnym.

Madeleine Baudot

programme.title: Wyzwanie - nowe mieszkanie 10
programme.desc: Program prezentuje najnowsze i najciekawsze oferty na rynku nieruchomości. Ekipa dąży do tego, by każdy z uczestników znalazł swoje upragnione cztery kąty - zarówno ci, którzy szukają lokum w centrum miasta, jak i ci, którzy marzą o spokojnym mieszkaniu z dala od zgiełku i chaosu. Prowadzący postara się, by każda oferta była dostosowana do wymagań bohaterów i spełniała ich najbardziej skrywane pragnienia.

programme.title: Wyzwanie - nowe mieszkanie 10

programme.title: Kucharskiego pomysł na kuchnię
programme.desc: Piotr Kucharski pokaże widzom, jak przełamać kulinarną rutynę i sprawić, by gotowanie było przyjemne, a jego efekt - smaczny.

programme.title: Myszka w paski: Akademia Zdrowia
programme.desc: Myszka w Paski opowie o wartościowych nawykach, które sprzyjają zdrowemu trybowi życia. Najlepiej wpajać je jak najwcześniej. Mali widzowie dowiedzą się, czym jest zdrowe odżywianie, co powinno się jeść codziennie, a czego unikać. Pokaże, jak zadbać o higienę i dokładnie wyszczotkować zęby. Razem z grupą ciekawskich przedszkolaków promuje gimnastykę i zabawę na świeżym powietrzu.

programme.title: Kupione i co dalej? 4
programme.desc: Projektantka Marta Czerkies urządza kolejne mieszkania i domy w stanie deweloperskim. Pomaga dostosować wizję wymarzonego wnętrza do możliwości finansowych. W programie znajdzie się też wiele praktycznych porad, inspiracji i remontowych trików.

programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

programme.title: Kazdy ma swoje lato
Każdy ma swoje lato
programme.desc: Kazdy ma swoje lato: Directed by Tomasz Jurkiewicz. With Nicolas Przygoda, Anita Poddebniak, Maciej Grzybowski, Sandra Drzymalska. The rebellious Agata comes to a small town to cook in an oasis. Seventeen-year-old Mirek, the son of a local organist, falls in love with her, and his grandfather, suffering from dementia, sees the girl as a lover from her youth. Mirek takes advantage of his grandfather's illness to get closer to Agata. programme.title: Moby Doc
Moby Doc
programme.desc: Moby Doc: Directed by Rob Gordon Bralver. With Moby, David Lynch, Julie Mintz, Gary Baseman. A surrealist biographical documentary about trailblazing electronic musician and animal rights activist Moby." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5452210/","name":"Moby Doc","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzViMmFlMjItODgxMy00NTg2LWIyZjAtODQwM2VjNmI5MmIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTM5NzYzNTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A surrealist biographical documentary about trailblazing electronic musician and animal rights activist Moby.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5452210/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"WePerished"},"dateCreated":"2021-07-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Somehow makes trauma feel like vanity","reviewBody":"As a big Moby fan back in the day I was really excited to see it. But what a bizarre documentary. Very contrived interview set up with fake conversations with fake psychiatrists and with people on the phone. Stylistically it jumps around and is very inconsistent. The story leaps around and doesn't link together and huge periods of his life are just left out. There's very odd b-roll choices and over-use of space and rockets. The humour feels awkward and makes the deeper stuff seem like it wasn't to be taken serious.\n\nBut the most disappointing thing was how insincere it comes across. For a story with so much trauma, sadness, suicide etc it comes across more as vanity than vulnerability. I appreciate bold creative choices, but boy did they make the wrong ones here. It just completely undermined the themes of the film. It's a mess that makes Moby less relatable. This is exactly how NOT to make a documentary about this subject matter.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":715,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"genre":["Documentary","Biography","Music"],"datePublished":"2021-05-28","keywords":"musician,fame,animal,vegan,grim reaper","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Moby Doc","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3750084633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjY3NTAxZjUtNjljZi00N2YzLTljZjUtMTExOGZiNDhlZjVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjY3NTAxZjUtNjljZi00N2YzLTljZjUtMTExOGZiNDhlZjVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005240/","name":"Moby"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000186/","name":"David Lynch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0591777/","name":"Julie Mintz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3964003/","name":"Rob Gordon Bralver"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0744176/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3964003/","name":"Rob Gordon Bralver"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005240/","name":"Moby"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: One Fine Day
Szczęśliwy dzień
One Fine Day
programme.desc:
One Fine Day: Directed by Michael Hoffman. With Michelle Pfeiffer, George Clooney, Mae Whitman, Alex D. Linz. The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0117247/","name":"One Fine Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDdhMjgxODQtZjNhNS00YjZiLWFmYTAtODZmM2RhM2M3YmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of two strangers and their young children unexpectedly intersect on one hectic, stressful day in New York City.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0117247/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"philipdavies"},"dateCreated":"2003-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment ...","reviewBody":"The headlong screwball comedy of this breakneck romance of two stressed-out single parents is a delight from beginning to end. It has scenes as quick witted - and often as wackily off-kilter! - as the adults must be just in order to survive their average day. Stir love into this mess of two increasingly desparate modern lives and you get a miraculous souffle of a film, at once sharp and sweet.

No scene is laboured, no point is telegraphed, and - phenomenally for a modern American film - neither kids nor kittens are allowed to smother the audience in the nauseous layers of cutesiness that are usually applied. The scene with the analyst, where Clooney must obscure his account of his sex-life in an ever-more-surrealistic periphrasis involving iced cakes and fish, since his little daughter has to accompany him into the presumably crecheless analyst's surgery, and her dad is embarassed to expose her to such adult matters as he is obliged to reveal during the session, is a scene which is a model of intelligent and stylish comedy writing. The dialogue of both himself and his analyst finally founders on the increasingly strained comparisons and metaphors being attempted. The analyst begins to construct an alarmingly kinky lifestyle for his client out of what he takes to be Freudian suggestions - but which are, as noted, merely the product of old-fashioned seemliness - whereupon Clooney is forced to bring the whole towering edifice back down to earth when his version of the morning's business with the goldfish gets mixed up in the heady brew of symbolism: 'No. I mean fish. You know - 'Fish' fish?'

The humour is all good, never strained, and beautifully played by all the principals, including the wonderfully un-sentimentalised children. The transformation, stage-by-stage, of the harsh mutual competition and resentment that exists at first between these harassed adults, into an exhausted truce, by way of barely-restrained irritation, grudging gratitude, reluctant respect, and growing affection, is handled with considerable dramatic finesse throughout.

To produce the unlikely union of such an ill-assorted pair under such utterly unpropitious and unromantic circumstances is a comedic challenge of considerable proportions, and the makers of this film do an excellent job to bring it off at all. The spirits of Grant and Hepburn - even Beatrice and Benedict - are not too far away.

The only disappointment is to see how many people in the audience have gone home just as sour as when they arrived, judging from some of the comments here. But then, love curdles in any mean-spirited breast.

 One particularly admires the fact that, at its conclusion, the film's romantic clincher - when the tired-out couple have to settle for just falling asleep together, despite their by now clearly desparate need for each other, - insists upon the importance of exactly this: Love, rather than merely lust, as the basis for an adult relationship.

Just occasionally, Hollywood still lets us have a grown-up entertainment. It makes a pleasant and wholesome change from the usual fare of adolescent dreams."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45255,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1996-12-20","keywords":"architect,united states,usa,mother son relationship,friendship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"One Fine Day","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3298689305","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJjMTlhOGYtZGM4MC00MjFiLTliMjEtYWI0NDdhNmQzNmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJjMTlhOGYtZGM4MC00MjFiLTliMjEtYWI0NDdhNmQzNmIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000201/","name":"Michelle Pfeiffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926165/","name":"Mae Whitman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001355/","name":"Michael Hoffman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002149/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0195234/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0783559/","name":"Terrel Seltzer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800124/","name":"Ellen Simon"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Chocolate Road

Chocolate Road
programme.desc: Chocolate Road: Directed by Tanya Chuturkova. With Frances Louise Bekele, Joe Cullen Brown, Martin Christy, Elvin Ovidio Ávila Flores. Three renowned chocolatiers - Maribel Lieberman, Susumu Koyama and Mikkel Friis-Holm - take us through the process of craft chocolate-making all the way from the tree to the final chocolate piece. On their journey, each of them finds how important it is to know the roots of their primer material - the cacao bean, and how they can highly impact the lives of the people involved in the chocolate production chain." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9866220/","name":"Chocolate Road","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmExMzg3NmMtMzM0ZC00M2E0LWJkMzMtNjUyZjk1NTAwZWFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjEzNjUxNTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three renowned chocolatiers - Maribel Lieberman, Susumu Koyama and Mikkel Friis-Holm - take us through the process of craft chocolate-making all the way from the tree to the final chocolate piece. programme.title: Kiler
Kiler
programme.desc: Kiler: Directed by Juliusz Machulski. With Cezary Pazura, Malgorzata Kozuchowska, Jerzy Stuhr, Janusz Rewinski. An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. Soon, he is sprung by a mob boss who needs "Killer" for a few more jobs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0127626/","name":"Kiler","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDRkNWMxYWEtODUwMC00ZDRjLWI0MmQtMjFjNTFiMDYwZDZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjExODE1MDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. Soon, he is sprung by a mob boss who needs "Killer" for a few more jobs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0127626/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cjpok"},"dateCreated":"1999-06-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Lots of action with funny twists","reviewBody":"This could easily be called the Polish version of "Pulp Fiction" but thank God, it is not. It is captivating from the very get-go, keeping the viewing audience as hostage to the very end. Although unique in style and approach, it is universal and could appeal to any audience, anywhere in the world. Humorous and tastefully prepared.No wonder Hollywood already bought rights to the story. We may see it on this side of the pond. I hope without Bruce Willis or other Hollywood screen "heroes". programme.title: The Pianist
Pianista
The Pianist
programme.desc:
The Pianist: Directed by Roman Polanski. With Adrien Brody, Emilia Fox, Michal Zebrowski, Ed Stoppard. A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0253474/","name":"The Pianist","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWRiZDIxZjktMTA1NC00MDQ2LWEzMjUtMTliZmY3NjQ3ODJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0253474/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ashcoounter"},"dateCreated":"2003-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brilliantly Narrated, Visually Stunning!","reviewBody":"Polanski has depicted the gory details of the holocaust without much restraint. But, the most wonderful aspect of the film is that the director has not lost focus of his story and instead of focusing too much on the holocaust horror he has weaved the true-life narrative of survival around devillish happenings.

Every single act of escapade Szpilman goes through is depicted like a drop of water on a barren desert. However, the Oasis in the driest desert comes in the end and it is here that Polanski captures the essence of human emotion. I had this very strong urge of jumping into the theater screen and magically adopting a character in the movie and doing something about the helplesness portrayed so convincingly.

Overall, Polanski has given a stunning visual narrative of the cold war. Survival indeed is a privilege though it is taken for granted today. Performances by Brody, Kretschmann deserve applause.

Pawel Edelman's camera work is moving and he has brilliantly captured the dark sadness in the visual canvas in an effective way. The lighting is amazing. Pre-dawn shooting schedule could have helped a great deal.

Hervé de Luze's editing work has ensured that the narrative does not slip away from focus. Most notable is the scene where the human bodies are lit on fire and the camera raises to show the smoke. The darkness of the smoke is enhanced and is used effectively to fade the scene out.

The scene where Brody's fingers move as he rests his hands on the bars of the tram handle only goes to show the brilliance of Polanski as a film-maker.

Great film that will be in the running for this year's Oscars. I will give it a 9 Out of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":777302,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"contentRating":"(Banned)","genre":["Biography","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2002-09-25","keywords":"pianist,holocaust,survival,nazi occupied poland,person in a wheelchair falls from height","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Pianist","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi988938521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ4MWQzNDEtYmI4Zi00NmY0LWEwYTEtZTg4MmQ3MDM2YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ4MWQzNDEtYmI4Zi00NmY0LWEwYTEtZTg4MmQ3MDM2YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Focus Features"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004778/","name":"Adrien Brody"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0470981/","name":"Thomas Kretschmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277975/","name":"Frank Finlay"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000591/","name":"Roman Polanski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024473/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030304/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053177/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367838/","name":"Ronald Harwood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0844262/","name":"Wladyslaw Szpilman"}],"duration":"PT2H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto
Polański, Horowitz. Hometown
programme.desc: Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto: Directed by Mateusz Kudla, Anna Kokoszka-Romer. With Roman Polanski, Ryszard Horowitz, Bronislawa Horowitz Karakulska, Stanislaw Buchala. Roman Polanski and Ryszard Horowitz came to Poland to share with us the most personal memories from their childhood and youth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8546414/","name":"Polanski, Horowitz. The Wizards from the Ghetto","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg0NmQ3NmEtY2NkOC00ZmI2LTg3YmUtNTc2MGEwNWQ2OWFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk5MjEzMTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Roman Polanski and Ryszard Horowitz came to Poland to share with us the most personal memories from their childhood and youth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8546414/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"belenus-133-722656"},"dateCreated":"2021-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very moving true strory.","reviewBody":"This is a beautiful documentary. It takes you right into the heart of the darkest period in the 20th century, right into the heart of a Holocaust - Krakow in Poland, where the famous Plaszow ghetto was located and where the trains were loaded for Auschwitz. It's also a very intimate and moving portrait of a true friendship between two great artists. We get to see incredible suffering but also have a chance to witness a fantastic sense of humour, which obviously is the best way to deal with such sad memories. We can also now understand why Polanski refused to film "The Shindler's List" and instead filmed "The Pianist". We should be very grateful to film authors. PS - People who give this film a low rating obviously have not seen it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2021-08-20","keywords":"childhood","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000591/","name":"Roman Polanski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1058543/","name":"Ryszard Horowitz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7061785/","name":"Bronislawa Horowitz Karakulska"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8896961/","name":"Mateusz Kudla"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9896989/","name":"Anna Kokoszka-Romer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0701909/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9896989/","name":"Anna Kokoszka-Romer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8896961/","name":"Mateusz Kudla"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Seasoned with Love
Przyprawione miłością
Seasoned with Love
programme.desc:
Seasoned with Love: Directed by Claude Desrosiers. With Julia Benson, Peter Benson, Tori Barban, Kolton Stewart. Winona Applegate is on the fast track to becoming a celebrity chef, already running a very successful bistro in Pittsburgh. With nerves building, she leaves for New York to audition for her own show in front of television executives. Unfortunately, her car breaks down near New Holland, a small, quirky town where Winona rents a room at a local inn run by Adam, a widower. With the local Spring Festival coming up and the resident cook unavailable to manage the menu, Winona agrees to get her car fixed in time for her audition in exchange for her much needed help in the Inn's kitchen. As she prepares for the festival with Adam, Winona begins to fall in love with New Holland and one of its residents as well." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13013696/","name":"Seasoned with Love","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzcyOWRiZGQtMzk2Ni00ODRjLWJiZTAtOGQxZGNhNTU4NDJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk1NzUwMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Winona Applegate is on the fast track to becoming a celebrity chef, already running a very successful bistro in Pittsburgh. With nerves building, she leaves for New York to audition for her own show in front of television executives.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13013696/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"peterkoch-98114"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"The ingredients of an enjoyable movie","reviewBody":"For a memorable feast you need a selection of fresh ingredients, a simple to follow recipe and a pot of imagination and good fortune. This film has those items sprinkled throughout. For men like me it's reassuring to have an average looking man win the heart of a gorgeously vivacious woman, even after finding out in real life they've been married more than 10 years. And also for married men it's encouraging to see that a woman is willing to fall in love with that man again after that much time has passed. I became so involved with the passage of this romance I fretted over the director dropping the ball in the final minutes, only to be surprised by one of the most convincing and satisfying endings I've seen.

Those actors that supported the main story also supplied a warmth that left an after taste that was richly enjoyable. My mother told me to never criticise other peoples' cooking, but I so enjoyed the film that those little thoughts didn't come to anything. It's not a complicated story, but importantly it's an interesting story, like a favourite meal I can see myself sitting down to enjoy again and again.

I've done a small number of reviews for films that surprised and unexpectedly delighted me, such that I hope you may feel the same. A realistic 7.5 score feels understated but heartfelt.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":153,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2021-04-30","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1365460/","name":"Julia Benson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1193045/","name":"Peter Benson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3379570/","name":"Tori Barban"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1068982/","name":"Claude Desrosiers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0099956/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0228741/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5949587/","name":"Gemma Holdway"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 13013696, Title: Seasoned with Love, --- Description: Seasoned with Love: Directed by Claude Desrosiers. With Julia Benson, Peter Benson, Tori Barban, Kolton Stewart. Winona Applegate is on the fast track to becoming a celebrity chef, already running a very successful bistro in Pittsburgh. With nerves building, she leaves for New York to audition for her own show in front of television executives. Unfortunately, her car breaks down near New Holland, a small, quirky town where Winona rents a room at a local inn run by Adam, a widower. With the local Spring Festival coming up and the resident cook unavailable to manage the menu, Winona agrees to get her car fixed in time for her audition in exchange for her much needed help in the Inn's kitchen. As she prepares for the festival with Adam, Winona begins to fall in love with New Holland and one of its residents as well." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13013696/","name":"Seasoned with Love","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzcyOWRiZGQtMzk2Ni00ODRjLWJiZTAtOGQxZGNhNTU4NDJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk1NzUwMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Winona Applegate is on the fast track to becoming a celebrity chef, already running a very successful bistro in Pittsburgh. For men like me it's reassuring to have an average looking man win the heart of a gorgeously vivacious woman, even after finding out in real life they've been married more than 10 years. And also for married men it's encouraging to see that a woman is willing to fall in love with that man again after that much time has passed. I became so involved with the passage of this romance I fretted over the director dropping the ball in the final minutes, only to be surprised by one of the most convincing and satisfying endings I've seen.

Those actors that supported the main story also supplied a warmth that left an after taste that was richly enjoyable. It's not a complicated story, but importantly it's an interesting story, like a favourite meal I can see myself sitting down to enjoy again and again.

I've done a small number of reviews for films that surprised and unexpectedly delighted me, such that I hope you may feel the same. An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1869716/","name":"The East","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyNjQzMzg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjExNzU1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1869716/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"AvidClimber"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stunning and unpretentious","reviewBody":"The East is the kind of movie that makes you want to join the fight, raise your voice and be heard.

The good. Extremely immersive. A incredible story with lots of emotions, conflicts, opposing moralities, and a stupefying journey. It is gripping and you will not be left unmoved.

The actors. Brit Marling and Ellen Page both give us a great performance. I was disappointed by Alexander Skarsgård, I thought that he was the weak player of the cast. The rest of the cell was pretty solid: Toby Kebbell, Shiloh Fernandez, Aldis Hodge, and Danielle Macdonald. And I should mention the nice work done by Patricia Clarkson as the director of the private security firm.

The bad. The ending is rushed. It feels like there was missing material at the end of filming and they couldn't go back to get what they needed and had to edit it with what they had.

The ugly. Nothing.

The result. A must see for anyone.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49676,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-06-28","keywords":"anarchist,ecoterrorism,environmental crime,nude swimming,male nudity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2067179033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities irrevocably changed after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations. programme.title: La vérité
Prawda
La vérité
programme.desc:
La vérité: Directed by Hirokazu Koreeda. With Catherine Deneuve, Juliette Binoche, Ethan Hawke, Clémentine Grenier. A stormy reunion between scriptwriter Lumir with her famous mother and actress, Fabienne, against the backdrop of Fabienne's autobiographic book and her latest role in a Sci-Fi picture as a daughter of a mother who never grows old." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8323120/","name":"La vérité","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDJjMTVhMzMtOTQwNC00MzVkLWE3YjMtMjkwYTQ0YzEyMjBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY3Nzc0OTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A stormy reunion between scriptwriter Lumir with her famous mother and actress, Fabienne, against the backdrop of Fabienne's autobiographic book and her latest role in a Sci-Fi picture as a daughter of a mother who never grows old.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8323120/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MartinHafer"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Surprisingly okay....and not much more","reviewBody":"The Japanese filmmaker Hirokazu Koreeda is famous for focusing on some of the darker aspects of what it is to be Japanese. Some folks in his homeland (including some politicians) have criticized his films for exposing these problem....though many film buffs have loved these same films. It's surprising, then, when you watch "The Truth"....not just because it has an all French and American cast but because unlike his films such as "Like Father, Like Son" and "Shoplifters", he DOES pull his punches and more often than not avoids pushing boundaries! As a result, my daughter and I enjoyed the film but were also very disappointed.

The film stars Catherine Deneuve and Juliet Binoche as a self-absorbed mother and her frustrated daughter during a visit. And, amazingly, by the end of the story, nothing much happens....few sparks and the big confrontation scene you expect (because the daughter deservedly resents her mother) never really materialize and the mother somehow receives absolution though she did little to merit it....again, NOT like what you'd expect in a Hirokazu Koreeda movie.

IMDb data; ttnr: 8323120, Title: La vérité, --- Description: La vérité: Directed by Hirokazu Koreeda. With Catherine Deneuve, Juliette Binoche, Ethan Hawke, Clémentine Grenier. A stormy reunion between scriptwriter Lumir with her famous mother and actress, Fabienne, against the backdrop of Fabienne's autobiographic book and her latest role in a Sci-Fi picture as a daughter of a mother who never grows old." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8323120/","name":"La vérité","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDJjMTVhMzMtOTQwNC00MzVkLWE3YjMtMjkwYTQ0YzEyMjBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY3Nzc0OTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A stormy reunion between scriptwriter Lumir with her famous mother and actress, Fabienne, against the backdrop of Fabienne's autobiographic book and her latest role in a Sci-Fi picture as a daughter of a mother who never grows old.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8323120/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"MartinHafer","dateCreated":"2019-11-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Surprisingly okay....and not much more","reviewBody":"The Japanese filmmaker Hirokazu Koreeda is famous for focusing on some of the darker aspects of what it is to be Japanese. Some folks in his homeland (including some politicians) have criticized his films for exposing these problem....though many film buffs have loved these same films. It's surprising, then, when you watch "The Truth"....not just because it has an all French and American cast but because unlike his films such as "Like Father, Like Son" and "Shoplifters", he DOES pull his punches and more often than not avoids pushing boundaries! As a result, my daughter and I enjoyed the film but were also very disappointed.

The film stars Catherine Deneuve and Juliet Binoche as a self-absorbed mother and her frustrated daughter during a visit. And, amazingly, by the end of the story, nothing much happens....few sparks and the big confrontation scene you expect (because the daughter deservedly resents her mother) never really materialize and the mother somehow receives absolution though she did little to merit it....again, NOT like what you'd expect in a Hirokazu Koreeda movie.

Overall, the acting was good but the story itself a bit flat.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6162,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-10-11","keywords":"aging actress,acting,tortoise,dog,title is not in english","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1405009689","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjlmODk2MjktMWNmNC00M2U1LWJkOTUtMjUwNGJiMDVhZDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjlmODk2MjktMWNmNC00M2U1LWJkOTUtMjUwNGJiMDVhZDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000366/","name":"Catherine Deneuve","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000300/","name":"Juliette Binoche","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000160/","name":"Ethan Hawke"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0466153/","name":"Hirokazu Koreeda"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0029856/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0567389/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0705123/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0466153/","name":"Hirokazu Koreeda","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7408787/","name":"Ken Liu"],"duration":"PT1H46M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Hirokazu Koreeda

programme.title: Une année polaire
Polarny rok
Une année polaire
programme.desc:
Une année polaire: Directed by Samuel Collardey. With Anders Hvidegaard, Asser Boassen, Thomasine Jonathansen, Gert Jonathansen. A teacher in Denmark takes a job in rural Greenland where he struggles to fit in with the locals." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7689932/","name":"Une année polaire","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGQ2ODFhODMtMjdkMS00M2Q5LTk4MjItZDJiMjZjZmNjZThlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzAyNTgyNjU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A teacher in Denmark takes a job in rural Greenland where he struggles to fit in with the locals.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7689932/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Carry it on!","reviewBody":"Hats off to Samuel Collardey!

Now and then ,there's a director who comes up with something different ,something which enthused us without any violence,sex scenes or blue jokes .

Like the director,the young schoolteacher takes his chances ;he refuses a post in a small town and opts for a tiny village (in the middle of nowhere ,the wonderful panoramics do show how isolated it is ) in Greenland where he is supposed to teach the Danish language.

Like the director, the hero wants to live an adventure : and he does ! No running water , a heating which breaks down ,pupils who do not care about what he teaches.Boisterous children who do not feel like going to secondary schools , because it would be a waste of time :every boy's ambition is to become a hunter ,and if he does not learn at an early age ,he will never be able to learn the tricks of the trade.

So what about learning history ,Luther and the Reformed religion?In a convential movie, the teacher would bring his reluctant students to "true" knowledge .The young Inuits eventually come to dominate their teacher : little by little, his way of life comes to resemble theirs,not the other way about .

Thus revivified by the people he wanted to educate (and their parents who were not really friendly,nay hostile :the lady hardly thanks the teacher who helped her boy to carry the heavy can ),he feels the "call of the wild" :then the movie becomes almost entirely a documentary (which it was, in parts,since the very beginning).

There are wonderful scenes of seal hunting ,with a snow storm which forces the men to build an igloo (which was always a shelter during the hunting time,and not a house where they live,as many children still think!);we are treated to the delight of an aurora borealis ;we are told an old legend , an "Hansel and Gretel" for Inuit kids;and because life is made of small pleasures and big griefs, we attend two funerals .(the minister is a woman ,which may puzzle some Catholic viewers.)

"Une Année" Polaire "(which in French sounds like "Scolaire " (school year),it's all this and more ;a great way to go off the beaten track of the French cinema .

Like this ? Try this

"Conrack " by Martin Ritt (1974)

"Why shoot the teacher?" by Silvio Narizzano (1977)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":319,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"genre":["Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-05-30","keywords":"2010s,greenland,denmark,new start in life,inuit","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9463264/","name":"Anders Hvidegaard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9876574/","name":"Asser Boassen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9876575/","name":"Thomasine Jonathansen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1848357/","name":"Samuel Collardey"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0484182/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044140/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0125554/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1771591/","name":"Catherine Paillé"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1848357/","name":"Samuel Collardey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2160922/","name":"Grégoire Debailly"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

programme.title: Słonie z bliska
programme.desc: Twórcy dokumentu zaglądają z kamerą do świata słoni, prezentując życie tych dostojnych ssaków, będących majestatycznym symbolem Czarnego Lądu. Thoralf Grospitz i Jens Westphalen spędzili na południu Afryki ponad dwa lata, podczas których przyglądali się z bliska życiu łagodnych gigantów. W efekcie powstał dwuczęściowy film przyrodniczy.

programme.desc:
Parenthood: Directed by Ron Howard. With Steve Martin, Mary Steenburgen, Dianne Wiest, Jason Robards. The Buckmans are a midwestern family all dealing with their lives: estranged relatives, raising children, pressures of the job, and learning to be a good parent and spouse." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098067/","name":"Parenthood","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ3OTIwNzI2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjgwNTcxMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Buckmans are a midwestern family all dealing with their lives: estranged relatives, raising children, pressures of the job, and learning to be a good parent and spouse.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098067/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chasman99"},"dateCreated":"2006-04-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Forever relevant","reviewBody":"I recall seeing this when it was released in '89. I found it funny but was only a Junior in high school at the time. Much of the humor and pain/struggle was lost on me. I rediscovered this on TV yesterday and just could not turn it off.

Having been married for a while and having kids of my own really brings this picture into focus. It is an amazing rendition of various families and how they are existing and treating their children. I identified so completely with Steve Martin's character that is was a bit scary.

I can see this film lasting the test of time very well. You can watch it as an outsider and enjoy the chaos or find yourself in one of the characters and enjoy the irony. Another Ron Howard masterpiece.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47745,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1989-08-02","keywords":"vomiting,dysfunctional family,cake,horse riding,happiness","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Parenthood","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi126786329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGQ0MTY1MmUtMjZhZS00OWEzLTg3N2EtMGYzZjhhMDEwYWUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGQ0MTY1MmUtMjZhZS00OWEzLTg3N2EtMGYzZjhhMDEwYWUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Parenthood"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000188/","name":"Steve Martin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005460/","name":"Mary Steenburgen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001848/","name":"Dianne Wiest"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0304665/","name":"Lowell Ganz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0541632/","name":"Babaloo Mandel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"}],"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

I found it funny but was only a Junior in high school at the time. Much of the humor and pain/struggle was lost on me. I rediscovered this on TV yesterday and just could not turn it off.

Having been married for a while and having kids of my own really brings this picture into focus. It is an amazing rendition of various families and how they are existing and treating their children. I identified so completely with Steve Martin's character that is was a bit scary.
